Home Mush Mush Discussion Suggestion/Ideas and Opinions
This thread contains Announcement(s) from community representatives :
[On 04 December 2013] KoLmafiaCan we have a summary of the types of[...]
On august 20, 2013
lilfighter

I`m starting this thread because firstly there isn`t a suited one for suggestions and the other official threads are invaded with bug reports.

So if we can get anyone from the team to look here form time to time then hopefully it will turn out a success.

My first suggestion is a simple one. I think notifications in each tab should update automatically. I mean I, for one, have to refresh the whole web page in order for tab notifications to update, or the notifications update when I post a message.
If an automatic, immediate, update of the notification is too stressful for the servers, then atleast a separate, tab-sided refresh button will work.

So what is your suggestion?

On august 20, 2013
Meadow

2. 'Shuffle' characters button when you select one out of four. However perhaps MT wishes you to choose one of the presented four or either be patient until your favorite characters comes by.

3. Another way to earn 'Klix' for the Vending Machine. This would be the same like the 'blue tickets' that you can earn monthly or through special means...

Kayin

On august 20, 2013
npfan
lilfighterMy first suggestion is a simple one. I think notifications in each tab should update automatically. I mean I, for one, have to refresh the whole web page in order for tab notifications to update, or the notifications update when I post a message.
If an automatic, immediate, update of the notification is too stressful for the servers, then atleast a separate, tab-sided refresh button will work.


Just like there's a 'Refresh list of threads' button for the forums so that you can see if there are new posts without refreshing the whole page, there should be a similar button that either refreshes all Mush tabs or one for each tab.

Another suggestion:
Instead of making the game so that you need to have a full ship with 16 out of 16 distinct characters, you could make it so that a full ship only needs 12 distinct characters or some other number lower than 16 because it is very likely some characters will be chosen more often than others. Unless you have an unlucky few forced to pick the missing 16th character of a ship, I could imagine that you would need at least four ships to have some members before one would become full. It also could make the game a bit more interesting because then you have ships with different combinations of characters for a more diverse gameplay.

On august 21, 2013
lilfighter

Regarding the Communications Officer:

I think the Communications officer should have the "special ability" to pin posts in the communications tab. Although I`m still very much an inexperienced newbie and didn`t even got to survive more than two days, I think this feature will be very helpful in cases like when we need to have an inventory with all the stuff we`ve got, or when going into an expedition-to have the plan set up with the steps pinned to the top so everybody knows what they are supposed to do..

These pinned messages will be at the top of the communications tab every cycle/day until the communications officer decides to un-pin them.
On august 21, 2013
Kayin

The Comm' officer can put a general announcement which is popping up at your log-in. He can also talk without the Walkie-Talkie. For pinned topics, you can do that by yourself, it will put on another chat tab with a yellow star.
On august 21, 2013
VooDooRUS

And the Commander can give you a special task with one bonus AP which is also popping up when you log in.
On august 21, 2013
Kompera

It would be nice if dismantled objects would tell the player this when he clicks on them, rather than leaving it up to the deduction of "Well, I can't examine or use it, it must be dismantled." After all, you can certainly examine a dismantled shower just as well as you can examine a functional shower.
On august 21, 2013
Kayin

It's up to the technician who dismantled to tell people he/she did it. It's a community-game, not a solo one.
On august 21, 2013
kiwiluke

the room logs should show the dismantling too
On august 21, 2013
Kompera

My point, if it was missed before, was that you can certainly examine a dismantled shower just as well as you can examine a functional shower. And having examined it, you should see that it has been dismantled.

That has nothing to do with the community aspect of the game, or the logs. It's just common sense.

It's also a lot clearer that an object is non-functional due to being dismantled when you can see that it is dismantled, and not just be unable to interact with the object. It looks like a bugged object, even if it is "working as intended."

On august 21, 2013
Rain

I would like to see the option to flirt with characters of any gender. It seems that the purpose of flirting is to raise morale, and I'd like the option to do that for any character whom I appreciate on board or who needs it. Or just for the fun towards people I like, since I really don't see the gender of the character we've chosen as terribly important.

Besides, it's the 32nd Century. Surely we can be a little less heteronormative than this, right?

Kayin

Official answer for "flirt/do it": same gender relationship has never seen the day in the Mush universe and will never see it.

It also serves the purpose for balance and difficulty in the game mechanics.
On august 21, 2013
Rain
Kayin

Official answer for "flirt/do it": same gender relationship has never seen the day in the Mush universe and will never see it.

It also serves the purpose for balance and difficulty in the game mechanics.

Meh, seems like pretty flimsy reasoning since they could incorporate it if they wanted to. Not claiming that I understand the full implications (or even partial implications, really) of these actions, but there is always more than one way to balance things. I find it rather disappointing that this game incorporates an explicit assumption of heterosexuality into its mechanics. Will it keep me from playing and eventually paying for this game? Probably not. But it will be a source of discontent for me (and I imagine others) regarding the game, so suggestion made, opinion put out there.
On august 21, 2013

Rain

I'll grant that there are valid design reasons for limiting the ability to restore morale, but enforcing hetero behavior is not the only way to do that. It's more that the devs don't see this as an issue or as being important to the community, so they don't have an incentive to reimagine it.

So no, never give your name in-game.

On august 25, 2013
npfan

There should be a heavy penalty for being Mush and getting killed. Right now, if you were assigned to be a Mush, do something that exposes you as a Mush, and then get killed, you end up with a high amount of that causes to get 'high' honours at the end of the game. In another words, a newb Mush would be considered under the current system to have a higher honour than all the humans who survived the best they could and more experienced Mush who survived longer and caused more subtle destruction.
On august 25, 2013
[1403405]

mush triumph continues to decrease after death. it decreases by 2 every cycle until the game is over.
On august 25, 2013
Meadow

Thus, if you the humans end up receiving a lot of honor/surviving, in the end the Mush score would be 0.
On august 26, 2013
rumata

Based on the Honors list of a dead ship, it seems you get the whole 120 Mush points when you are turned, and the countdown only starts from that point in time.
I don't know if this will be working well like this when we have the whole ship functionality and more experienced players, but right now this certainly favors the last-minute Mush converted a lot.
On august 26, 2013
rumata

Finally got to browse some more end credits (like Bugzilla's latest ship), and it seems Mushification is worth less when you turn late in the game. Good to know.
On august 26, 2013
[1403405]

at conversion you get 120 -2 * #cycles since the game started. The reason why late mush seems to have huge triumph is because they keep their human triumph earned at that point. It is a problem raised many time on the french server because it is usually the latest mush that wins if mush wins, not the original ones (who should have more credit.). I think human triumph should not be kept or at least the +1/cycle human gets should be removed to be fair.

On august 27, 2013
[1403405]

What I am saying is : if you open a private channel with someone solely to check if that person is online or was online recently, for instance because you realized a new mush appeared less than 5mn ago, it is cheating and is in principle not allowed. You should use logs from rooms to see if someone was doing something at a certain time.
If you have a good reason to have a private channel with someone, that is fine and is not the same thing. Teams working on the projects/researches/Pilgred can have a private channel where they organize and discuss things.

On august 27, 2013
Kayin

EpoqAs the rule goes, if something is too good to be true, it usually is. If you find a way to acquire a mountain of gold coins quickly by forcing something to happen that wouldn't naturally, then there's a good chance you're not supposed to be doing it. Ok that's for DinoRPG, but you can see for yourself how things could be done around for Mush. There's several things not allowed, but not strictly written.

  • Posting a screenshot to prove who you are: can be easily forged with the right knowledge.
  • Creating a whole crew discussion to check on who's online: It's too much of an advantage, I will always leave, create three private discussions avoid of people and if threaten and then killed, since it's for a petty reason I could still alert on him.
On august 30, 2013
Rain
stevyn‚Ä¢ In the 'Titles' section of the Help menu Kim Jin Su is written Kim Jim Su in the 3 lists of title hierarchy

Suggestion: Change his name to Kim Jim Su.

On august 30, 2013
Kompera
SeraphYeah external links on general ship chat was a worry that occurred to me. There will be some people who will probably try to prove they are not mush by posting screenshot of his status and something similar. And that could pretty much ruin the game.

This would either be impossible to verify and/or too easy to abuse.

Impossible to verify: No admin will have access to either the IRC channel, any record of who opened it, or any record of who said what in that channel.

Easy to abuse: If admins ban people due to posting of IRC logs, just be aware that it's way too easy to either manufacture a false log out of whole cloth, or to even simply log into an IRC channel using the same /nick as someone's Twinoid profile name and say whatever you want to say, and then invite admins to join the channel for the 'proof' that someone was doing something wrong.
On august 30, 2013

I too agree that flirt should be allowed to happen even between same-gender characters.
I understand the "balancing reason" if this means "adding some difficult in getting morale back by not allowing flirting with just anyone", but it could have been done in other ways (like having more characters who are close relatives).

Anyone talking about "adding a chit-chat" option for same-gendered character isn't understanding the issue: people don't want to just make the game more simple (and go against the intended "balancing"), they want to avoid being forced in act as hetero.

Kompera

You might want to check your homophobia at the door.

My avatar is _tame_, the only people who find it objectionable are either homophobes or are sexually repressed. A kiss between two women isn't porn, people. You'll see he same walking down the streets of any major city.

I'm not homophobic, but I really have problems with your avatar.
Your insults about people being homophobic are... well, I'll avoid adding more insults to the mix by naming what you said. I have some sense of decency, and this applies to all sexes and all ways you can match them: having to watch a man and a woman doing the same thing wouldn't change my perception of it.

If, walking by the street, I saw two people doing and doing again the same action like that (because your avatar continue to repeat it, so it's not just a lovely kiss between two people), I would just look away... exactly in the same way I'm trying not to look at your avatar. I'm not a voyeur, and I don't like people having to make me choose between reading the forums and watching avatars like yours.

And I'm not sexually repressed either! Try to tell it and I'll report you.
You're being very rude, not just for your distasteful choice of avatar, but for your reactions at people telling you that they don't like it.

On august 31, 2013
Meadow
ComedianWhere are these rules located? People just joining will not know this, I almost posted my twinoid name.

The rules are here. http://mush.twinoid.com/help?cat=gene...

However it doesn't mentions the above, quote - it is indeed in effect. Why? Because, it can promote "cooperation" e.g. Player A is Human and Player B is Mush, they can cooperate outside the game on IRC, but there is no proof at all they did 'cooperate' because it didn't happen in game.

That is why revealing Twinoid names+IRC is banned, and you should not attempt anything whatsoever in that form. I think there was an exception in the case of Castings (not yet in effect) but I'd like to see a better clarification in an extended form on the rules page from Epoq if possible.

Atleast, the above applies to French Mush - take a look at the SDF section.

Another example is, if you know that Player A is actually Twinoid A, and you had a bad experience with Twinoid A in a past life you can tell other people "OMG AVOID, KILL, BLABLA". People are supposed to be anonymous here - their names will be revealed after the game is done. And all judges/moderation can see all the actions you've done ingame ofcourse. Griefers and Inactives are not tolerated from both sides (Human/Mush).

spacekadt

I'm transplanting this here:

RainI think that once beta is over this sort of thing will be a pretty big problem though. If gold mode prices stay what is shown on the page currently (10 Euro for a month), I probably won't buy it more than once for the unlocks anyways just due to the price. But the risk of spending that money and then ending up on a ship that isn't fun and I have no way off of til it dies, and if I'm human it's against the rules to speed along the end of or get myself killed.... Well that really discourages me from buying gold days as well.

Bold emphasis mine because that's the part I want to focus on.

The ship I'm on now is absolutely miserable for the most part. Very few people are doing much of anything, much less what they should be doing. If I were wasting days I actually paid for on this ship, I'd be LIVID that I was spending so much money for each passing day of shittiness.

There really needs to be some sort of mechanic that allows people to either keep their days from counting down or a way off of a ship that just refuses to die but doesn't do much other than float in space. I'd be happy with the option to turn off my gold days and have just the one or two skills allowed (yes, I know it would technically be two, but I'd even be willing to be "punished" for turning off gold days and only have one skill available).

In d2n, you have the ability to walk outside and not come back. Or take cyanide. Or a poisoned ration. In every other game (at least the ones I've played), it's token based to use as you choose. Between using the same d2n "hero" method but making it not only impossible but against the rules to off yourself, you're really setting people up to spend a lot of money that they'll resent spending and cost yourself in the long run.

If you look up my game and payment history, you can see just how much I've spent on your games... that I'm seriously considering not paying for this one should say a lot.

On september 12, 2013
[920355]

It doesn't feel as poorly optimized as you're making it sound, I don't think. I feel it functions well, and considering the smaller size I like it better than something identical to a forum layout like in Die2nite. Having all the conversations available in one big scroll adds to the transparency, that everyone is always listening in on the Walkie-Talkie and can chime in to help out or capitalize on some vital information you might have slipped. i.e.: ("We'll throw a grenade into the room with all the Mush")

I feel like a forum similar to Die2nite, even built into the same page you game on, would make it even harder to garner inactive players attention. I like how all the chatter can be seen at a moment's notice and it really encourages discussion.


A refresh button might be neat, though. I guess I'm just fine with F5ing too though.

I don't want to be fuss over leaderboards or anything like that, but it did occur to me that it's significantly easier to earn points as Roland than any other character. I have been working hard on my ship as Ian (And in another session, Raluca.) but even as we near the same day that my Roland had amassed nearly 200 glory, I have only 25. So many goals are either limited or take entire days to complete or begin completing, that Roland has a very huge advantage in obtaining glory from the only infinite thing in the universe: Hunters. This is probably compounded by the fact that he doesn't even need to be the one to shoot them down, meaning that a ship lasting many days just gorges Roland with experience while the rest of us rely on biology research and strange requests.

On september 13, 2013
Zanarkand

Speaking of glory balance, Gioele's glory bonus objective is kind of contra productive. He earns 3 glory points for every mush killed. Not only is this far too few, it also means he will make the most of that bonus when the mush are winning over human after human. So for him, it would actually be good if mush were taking over, so that he could kill more of them and earn more glory. That's just ridiculous.

And I have talked about my disapproval of Eleesha's objective as well. It makes little sense to me that she would get extra glory for something she can't do at all. It's Paola's job to contact the rebel bases, not hers.

The character design appears to be flawed in general. Some characters appear to be super useful, while others are worth nothing. Who in their right mind would actually want to play Gioele or Stephen? Especially if they could be someone fun to play like Roland, Hua, Jin Su, and co.

This game needs some serious balancing in my opinion.
On september 13, 2013
Meadow

The question is... How to actually re-balance them? Are the existing skills not good enough? What kind of skills would fit them without making them an exact carbon copy of another character? Should there be entirely new skills developed just to benefit two characters?
On september 13, 2013
Meadow

+Does it weighs up against the cost of developing it once more?
On september 13, 2013
Zanarkand

I have no idea about Stephen, but Gioele was clearly intended to be a character who is supposed to do everything no one else has time for. A jack of all trades so to say. The problem with him is, though, that he isn't a jack of all trades but a jack who doesn't know shit. Everything he does, someone will do better, so he ends up helping out, but wastes a lot of Ap doing something someone else could have done for less AP.

Wouldn't it be more interesting to give him a skill that allowed him to get bonuses on tasks depending on what is currently needed? Let's say The ship is under attack again but Roland was too busy with the expedition he led a couple hours ago. He has no Ap and no one else can be bothered to jump into a patrol ship and do some shooting. So someone (maybe Jin Su, since he is the commander) can assign Giole a mission and if he accepts, he gains the amateur pilot perk. He can use the patrol ship, but his default chances on hit aren't 80% like with every other pilot, but 60%. That's still 30% more than he would have had with a turret, but less than an actual pilot would have had. He would be the middle way.

Another example:

Stuff is broken. A lot of stuff. But Terrence has gone to sleep and it would be better for someone to repair the leak in the oxygen tank fast. Gioele is available, so someone assigns him a mission which he accepts. He becomes an amateur technician. He gets slightly better chances to repair stuff, but no technician points. Seems like a fair deal, right?

That way, Gioele could end up to be an interesting character people would actually want to play. After all, that way, you would always have a different day on board the Deadalus.

His glory gain could depend on the successful tasks done while he was assigned a mission. 0.5 glory for every hunter killed as an amateur pilot. 0.5 glory for everything repaired as an amateur technician.

I don't know if that would be balanced, but it certainly would make the character more interesting at least.

On september 13, 2013
Meadow

Well in my opinion Gioele's glory should be changed like this:
Gets 3 Glory for survival until the end for himself, in addition also with his daugher (Total 6) for finishing return to Sol or Eden.
Gets 2 additional Glory for every surviving member of the ship.
Gets 1 additional Glory for killing Mush.

The first one is ofcourse RP, he bought and funded the entire ship. So he wants to survive. Alright, maybe it should only be +3 Glory for surviving with Paola. But you get the idea.
To prevent Gioele possibly "griefing" by waiting until the ship is filled with Mush (he has an important 5th skill that reflects this) he will get an addition of 2 Glory for every surviving member. Or just 1.
Last one is ofcourse one additional Glory for killing Mush. In Supplemental of his 6th skill if I remember correctly?

This is just thinking hard. Opinion appreciated.

As for Stephen, I don't feel that he is in the right spot now. In my opinion he should get an additional skill replacing another skill that doesn't quite fit with him as the Chef Cook of the Daedalus.

The type skill would be named "Extravaganza Meadow Cook" (In honor of Chef Meadow) that can grant a random bonus of AP/MP/Morale/HP up to 3 for preparing rations for anyone who likes to eat it.

It would replace the skill... Shooter.

As for Eleesha's glory, it would be much harder. In my eyes Janice fits the Comms Officer role very nicely. It would need to change the story, change who the Comms Officer will be first. I do not like it if they switch their Glory goals. More input needed here.

I do agree, he is highly reliant on the active people that A: Finding a planet B: Fuel & Move the Ship C: Form an expedition and don't forget to get Ian or multiple botanists on board for extra fruit. We've had around 12 people active out of 16, whereas 2 Mush that we killed (my detective nose).

Unfortunate Chao got repeatedly some metal plates on his face so he died early on.

We've reached Day 10. Could've been better perhaps had several players been a tiny bit more active, but it is an impressive feat.

Should've planted those extra fruits to gain more glory...

Excellent point, Meadow. It's totally possible to earn a good chunk of Glory as the other characters, but I shouldn't have to rely on an entire cast of 14 players to get me up there. I like how that encourages group play, but I don't want my entire session to be reliant on how much other people did for me. This is the same problem I would bet Eleesha has, having to convince Paola to actually do her coms work or otherwise killing her before she gets to control her own Glory.
On september 15, 2013
Zanarkand

I have a suggestion regarding Terrence. It's kinda a big deal, so it probably won't even get into consideration, but here I go anyway:

Merge robotics expert and technician. Only without the "starts with a drone plan". Instead, let a drone plan be somewhere on the ship. Or let Terrence start with one by default.

pro:
- every technician on board will be able to upgrade the drones and thus helping Terrence gain glory
- Terrence will be able to do important repairs whenever needed. He isn't limited to waiting for more scrap to come in as well as hunting down his own drones as a disabled man to upgrade them.

contra:
- he loses his exclusive right to upgrade drones. (But in all honesty. I am sure all players would rather have everyone help with them than running around the ship to catch those things. Plus, since there won't be so many gold players around after beta, so there will hardly ever be 2 technicians on board anyway.)
- this way, he loses one level up skill and will have less to offer than other characters

It might be quite a buff for him, but if you consider his role from the view of a f2p player, Terrence just won't offer much in terms of gameplay. Having to play a character who will rarely move around in the ship unless he has to, being stuck with only drones and the other side tasks everyone has to do, can be quite boring. If that's too much asked for, how about at least adding this to the robotics expert skill:

"Every day, you gain 1 robotics expert point. This allows you to assemble a construction plan for free!"

Currently, constructing an object via construction plan costs 3 AP, which is kinda a lot considering you only get 1 each cycle. (2 if laid down). Letting Terrence use his robotics expert skill to easily figure out plans and build an object wouldn't be too far fetched, no? This way, he would at least be of some importance to other crew members, who hardly give a damn about him as he is now. They would turn to him when they want to have blueprints used. (They do so already, but only because they already assume it is his job because he handles the scrap metal the most. But in fact, everyone can use blueprints. Terrence gains no bonus on it.)

But well, that's just my opinion. I think Terrence will be a rather low tier character for f2p players, so buffing him would be a good idea.

On september 17, 2013
Meadow

I had an idea about water, since well we don't really have anything like water unlike D2N where that is our 'main' survival method. In Mush, this would be food. Depending on type of food you need it every so often atleast for the first time in 3 days.

I was thinking about a 'water variant'. Instead of giving AP, it gives MP and perhaps also satisfaction/AP or so. Anyway, the ways to gain 'water' is simple, every cycle that ends it adds up some 'water' "H2O" to the 'crew tank' that holds it. If you 'cook it' to make sure there is no ugly spores left or not people can drink it to gain MP.

Also you can for example find undrinkable water in the ocean and take it with you in a small plastic pack or so and clean it up.

I believe the process from air to water and back to air is a water cycle? Anyway, you could for example with advanced projects/research create air to water (1 O2 = 5 H2O units) and water to air (10 H2O = 1 O2)

These are random numbers, and might seem unfair to keep the game 'balanced' would this idea be implemented.

Thoughts about this?

In addition, you could use H2O, to create 'better food' that includes a random 1-4 MP in addition to AP in cooked food.

I have made the suggestion about Stephen changing a few skills to make him 'more fun' to play other than sitting 3 days on his butt and waiting until the third day if he's a Mush to spore it all, and/or just finally to create food and deliver it around the ship.

(My suggestion about Stephen here: http://twd.io/e/Q0yV0g/136 )

On september 24, 2013
Absydian

One ship I was on a few days ago I really screwed myself, thanks to a rubbishy mechanic in the game; I go into Bravo Bay and find the mush sample, so I take it straight to the lab. Two hours later I get told I'm a mush, and a helpful little hint pops up telling me to find the mush sample and hide it... by this time the crew have already got antispore gas and it virtually impossible to turn anyone before they complete the next two projects; the mycoscan and the spore sucker.

I get the reason why you don't get told you're a mush when you first join the game; if your the first awake you could wreak havoc with no one to stop you, but on the other side of the story, its not really fair to mush since you start playing assuming you're human. At the very least, please don't spawn the mush sample until AFTER the whole crew wake up.

At least then, as a mush, you don't start off kicking yourself for helping the enemy and on the back foot with 1-2 anti-mush researches done.

Enfilade
rumataIt is the same tactic in the Battlestar Galactica boardgame as well. You might not know you are "mush" (cylon) until the second half of the game starts, so you have to downplay it a little bit. Not doing harm, but not being extra-helpful to humans either.

That board game is the best analogue I've found to describe Mush to others. Players have an incentive to not let the game too well, otherwise they're setting themselves up for a harder game if they become the enemy. As a rule, I don't participate very much until everyone is unfrozen; I use that extra time to RP and get to know people (which can be useful later on, mush or human).

On october 3, 2013
Kompera

The chat interface is a turd. It follows no common markup. There is no way for a player to know how to enter a newline, if you hit <enter> it posts what you have typed so far.

Not to mention bolds or italics. I tried <b> and

</b>, to no avail. Bolds appear to be enabled by bracketing with *. That's really stupid.

Fix this. It's so easy, even this forum has better markup options, even if it requires clicking to effect markup rather than using commonly used markup tags.
On october 6, 2013
BerZerg

MT, please consider the following:
- combining images into a sprite map. Pages will load much faster if you do this.
- make sure the browser sends Etag and/or Last-Modified headers on fetching images, so that browser caching is used. All image GET calls now return a 200, which means they are fully fetched over and over again. Waste of bandwidth

My account - My settings - Toggle advanced mush do?

On october 22, 2013
[1403405]

it let you pick your human skill when you are a mush if you have empty slots for your human skills.

This was mainly for transfer purpose or when you are the last one to arrive on the ship and you are picked as mush directly: you need to decide both human and mush skills.
Before, you could not pick your human skills, those were automatically filled for you. In case of transfer, if you take control of the body of someone who picked skills not in order, or avoided to pick the level 1 and only picked level 2 for instance, your human skill slots were filled automatically, and one could notice something changed in your skills.

On october 22, 2013
[1403405]

Another problem connected to this:

if you have more available skills than available slots, then nothing is chosen for you (this is good), it is only if you have the same or less skills than available slots that the system choose for you (this is bad).

BUT, if you are in the first case, if you decide to not pick any human skills, waiting to see if you will be mush or not, the system will pick human skills randomly if you are mush among the available ones to fill up the available slots at the exact second the mush are designated! So, if you are online at the time the mush are picked and you know someone has no skill picked, you can tell directly if that person is human or mush: if suddenly that person has skills, it is a mush! I don't know however if this is desactivated by the option of advanced skill management

so always pick at least one skill!
On october 22, 2013
rumata

It is deactivated if you have Advanced Mush on.

You get to pick your own human skills even if you are Alpha Mush.

On november 3, 2013
Aivaras

New title: Stores Manager, I would assign it to Terrance.

Way it works:

New Module - when person clicks on any shelf he can see Access Terminal button, when clicked it would show new window (like planet scanning, comms. post-it notes and so on) with list of rooms and item in it. This is available to every player.

Player with title Stores Manager can edit those entries. Terrance only

This would make equipment organizing better but same time Mush could misinform Terrance, or if Terrance is mush he can edit them to confuse team...

Also as Absydian said. way of seeing Drones on minimap would be sweet! Maybe make it so everyone with Robotics skill can do it or project/research. What I wanted to add is 2 markers - active dron and broken one. Let's say active Drone flashes (like your location) while broken drone has same colour but not flashing marker.
On november 3, 2013
Cleef
Aivaras

New title: Stores Manager, I would assign it to Terrance.

Way it works:

New Module - when person clicks on any shelf he can see Access Terminal button, when clicked it would show new window (like planet scanning, comms. post-it notes and so on) with list of rooms and item in it. This is available to every player.

Player with title Stores Manager can edit those entries. Terrance only

This would make equipment organizing better but same time Mush could misinform Terrance, or if Terrance is mush he can edit them to confuse team...

Also as Absydian said. way of seeing Drones on minimap would be sweet! Maybe make it so everyone with Robotics skill can do it or project/research. On november 18, 2013
[7915070]

Apparently some people haven't realized that we're talking about "idle" as a specific game term.

To clarify: when both your AP and MP bars fill up, there's a message posted in the room log about how you're drooling in your sleep, you get a "Zzz" status indicator to mark you as idle, and you're even listed as idle in the cryo-unit's crew roster. Keep it up for five days or so and if the ship is still going and nobody kills you in the meantime, you'll starve to death.

THAT is the situation we're talking about here. As it stands, you continue to earn glory and above all XP even when you're idle for the entire game. That's not good. Hence this idea:

Cleef

How about for every cycle a player is inactive:

Human: Does not earn 1
Mush: Minus 4
Human and Mush: Does not earn EXP
On november 21, 2013
[7915070]

I would also suggest adding a simpler mechanic to replace the three title holders. Particularly the commander seems to need replacing often. Currently it can only be done by killing him or waiting for him to go idle. If the commander is not idle, but refuses to do his job in spite of his crew begging, suddenly you have a big problem -- he has to be killed.

But what if he's in a patrol craft? This is not only an excessively powerful and annoying mush tactic, even with a human captain this stuff happens. Then you have no choice but to try to use the hacker kit, and it's really not a very practical option with the poor success chance. So really, why is there no way to simply replace the commander?

On december 4, 2013
TradeFederation
PucorNot exacly. Imagine that You don't have time durning next two weeks to play mush. But thats 112 XP on bronze/silver and 224 on gold. well so join ship - go inactive and earn XP either way.


You have a valid point, since XP is a WAY more useful and persistent than Glory in this game. I guess join-then-ignore could be used intentionally as a type of XP boosting, even better if you are chosen as alpha mush (you won't starve, and can get XP until someone or PVE kills you) but it would be destructive to the game as a whole, since more people will quit over time if every ship has a bunch of XP boosters in it. Of course, this is all hypothetical for now, since I assume most inactos are new 'legitimate' players at this point, because of the VERY slow nature of this game, I could easily see many Twinoid gamers just bowing out when they see how slowly AP return if not in a bed, but this specific issue is easily fixed.


I propose that XP gain be cut off as soon as a player goes inactive, and that they receive none for the entire voyage, if they die while inactive (or never become active again) Kind of like the Clean distinction in Die2Nite. Once you dope up, you don't get any points for being clean for that game, even if you were clean for a while at first.
On december 4, 2013
[7922882]

What TradeFederation says sounds fair. The reasoning I've heard from moderators so far about not punishing inactives was centered around the fact that if they are inactive they aren't playing the game anyway so they will probably quit and stop joining ships, thus no need to punish them.

But if people are continually joining ships and going inactive, that could be a problem especially if done purposefully to gain XP like Pucor mentioned.

On december 4, 2013
Annette

Another way to look at this is we are a PvP server and that's our only option right now. So, each ship you join you are choosing the unpredictable nature of a public PvP server. Now, with private ships, or Castings, you will be more PvE as you can all agree on conditions as players. For example, you must all log in a certain amount of times a day, be active, be cordial, etc.

It's not the game that needs to change it's how we see it.

On december 5, 2013
[2395583]

instead of cyanide pills, escape pods - they take their chances by crash landing on a planet, but must drop all items before entering the pod. that way the 'death' would not have as great an impact on morale? this would give a way to exit laggard ships. speaking of which, perhaps an option to 'turn on or off' the gold days once per game. if the ship is lagging, you can turn change your gold level, in order to save them up as appropriate.

also, it seems that the comms officer has a whole lot that is dependent solely upon them - neuron updates, communication with rebel bases, and so on... it would make sense for eleesha to have access to the rebel base option - given her background story (plus, there is not a whole lot else for her to do at low levels), and janice to have access to the upgrade neuron option, respectively and specifically.

also, there needs to be a way to message inactive players - perhaps an anonymous message "a pager call to their tracker" which would send an IM to the players twinoid account saying "character-name has paged you in your mush game, they need your help!" this would preserve the in-game anonymity and allow a method to pester/remind inactives that they are still needed.

ShuDog

Logging off while holding important items is sometimes not intentional.

I say as I watch the blizzard on the radar.

EDIT: reading the above -- the cryochambers really ought to be utilized in this game. I've made pleas for it regarding re-humanized Mush. I mean, it would just be awesome to have another terminal and research trees where you're playing for someone's life.

[Suggestion] Load them into cryochambers if they're inactive. Penalty only for moving heavy objects. They cannot regain titles while in cryo. Have any number of research objectives (maybe even Communications!) as to whether or not they can be revived. Heck, there could be a research objective that would clear out their spores while in cryo!
On december 5, 2013
TradeFederation

Cryo chambers are the Deus Ex Machina of Sci Fi, and can be used to stop, or at least delay most problems on the ship, if they were implemented after the start of the game as a gameplay element, but the designers of Mush consider Inactivity and deaths to be a normal part of the game, and keep shooting down similar requests about inactives, so it seems there is little point in continuing to make this particular request, unfortunately.

On december 6, 2013
TradeFederation
ComedianI'd like to see some more balance in certain characters. Janice and Paola have many useful skills/roles. Where as Stephen and Gioele are pretty useless. Having another character with a morale booster skill would be nice.

There are balance issues all over the place with the skills, some of which are fixed by leveling up, eventually, although that can take a LOT of patience, even for a gold player. Stephen usually becomes incredibly good at level 5, when he gets Apprentice, but its SOOO far out in XP, its almost a MONTH just to level to 4, assuming you are saving all your XP for him, which is highly unlikely.


Chun and Gioele suffer because their best skills don't help them directly. Chun's saviour skill sure helps morale, but it only stops a negative, she can't actually DO anything (gameplay wise) with it (like skill points), and it tends to gets taken for granted by the crew, and then she gets hauled to the lab to be a living research item, leading to a really bored (and soon to go inacto) Chun. Gioele is the same, Paranoid's +2 cameras pretty much lets you lock down every important 'person room' on the ship, but after you place the second one in the first 5 minutes, the rest of the game is resetting other people's better research %'s, and other misc stuff, as his other skills are all meh or situational, at least until level 4.


On the flip side, certain skills are hugely overpowered, relative to all the others. Janice's shrink skill, although mostly passive, just breaks the entire morale and mental disease system of the game, allowing her to, with only a single skill, and for no AP, basically buff everyone's morale back to full and cure all mental illnesses, even starting character flaws like Eleesha's vertigo, with only a little dorm coordination from the crew. And on top of all that, you can also actively buff morale even more, and get research bonuses. The Tech skill is also infamous in this game, mostly for all the things you CANT do or build without it, if you are on a n00b ship where no one started with it, because it is the only key skill that no one starts with at level 1, but you can't build many of the best blueprint items without it, and its just all around useful for dealing with all the accidents and "accidents on purpose" that are sure to happen on every ship, you also get a free repair point every day, bonuses on NERON projects, but the unbelievably awesome cherry on top of the Tech skill is the PILGRED bonus, which can make it really easy to fix the engine with an active Raluca, Two days tops, if you focus on it I also like Logistics a lot. This game is super limited by the tiny AP regeneration rate, and this skill basically changes that entirely, and you can double up the effect with bed time as well, although an inconveniently located inactive can really mess this skill up

On december 6, 2013
TradeFederation
blubberflashWhat do you think about that people who have got titles are able to assign them (maybe for some ap) to another crew member?

I'd definitely like to see this one, it just makes no sense to wait for the captain to come back online to move the ship in an emergency situation, and there are tons of Star Trek episodes where another member of the crew is acting captain during the off times on the ship. Often a new player picks Jin Su by mistake, not realizing how much real life time they would need to play this game not to hurt the ship, This exact thing happened to me on my first game, I wish I could have handed off command in that game.

On december 6, 2013
[1419839]

So, here's something I would really like.

If you've played at least one ship, and you are selecting your character, I would like there to be a checkbox you can select (or not select) that says "I would like to be Mush (odds of being Alpha Mush increased)"

We already know there is a lottery system in place, where any player CAN be mush but experienced players get more "tickets" when the selection is run. This would just be a way to slightly tilt the odds.

Assume each newbie gets 1 ticket right now, and everyone gets an additional ticket for their first three ships (it doesn't work like that I'm sure, but close enough). Selecting this box would simply double the amount of tickets your character has drawn.

On a ship full of people with an equal experience level who DON'T select the option, your base odds would be:
3/48, or 6.25% of being the first mush and an additional 3/45 or 6.66% chance of being the second alpha mush.

With this system, if you were the only one to select the option, you would have a
6/51, 11.7% chance to be the first alpha mush and a 12.5% chance to be the second.

This means that you would still be more likely to be not-Mush than Mush, but if you like and enjoy playing as the Alpha Mush (or you don't like to) it at least gives you the opportunity to alter the odds in favour of your preferred play style - so long as other people on the ship share an opposed preference.

I think this would go a long way towards giving people a more enjoyable experience, honestly.
On december 6, 2013
[1384452]

That's almost common sense, so I thought there was a good reason why they didn't do that. One of the issues with the game now is that people who don't want to be mush are playing as mush and don't really do a good job at it.
On december 6, 2013
Annette
SagittaeriWon't it be better than logging in and finding out that they've been assassinated for their items?

Why are you killing people for their items in the first place? They are their items, sometimes paid for and certainly entitled to them. Killing people for inactivity isn't allowed. A Comms officer who is just active enough to keep their title is hurting the team though. A non title holder, just being inactive is a neutral action, ignore them or try to communicate with them but you certainly aren't allowed to kill them for this reason alone.


MrMuz[SUGGESTION] Cyanide in the Vending Machine for 5 Klix.

Suicide is bad because it ruins the game for the rest of the team. But on the other hand, there are times when you are trapped on a completely hopeless ship with only 3 actives or so. So why not have a penalty for suicide especially to those who are having their Gold days run out and not having fun? (And MT can make a little RL money off that penalty as well)

Cyanide deaths can just be similar to every other 'demoralized and killed themselves' effect, with no morale loss for the rest of the crew.

Committing suicide in any capacity is completely against the spirit of this game, the devs are not going to add cyanide to the vending machine.

On december 10, 2013
Calib
kumquatThirded to mush be able to use spore sucker on themselves like humans. Really kills the fun of the game to have a definitive mush test.

The thing is that the Spore Sucker takes time and a lot of research to do. It's also dangerous to go testing everyone. Test the wrong folks and they can be injured or even DIE.

Ever see the movie "The Thing"? Either version... it's a lot like Mush! You have a bunch of people isolated and a parasite that takes them over via repeated exposure. There was a test in that film, too: Put some of the person's blood over a fire! It was dangerous and hard to do.

If anything I think hitting a Mush should result in a FREAK OUT. Something like dealing 5 damage to everyone in the room and wiping that cycle's logs from the room records. It just turns it blank in the records.
On december 10, 2013
[7896920]

I think you are exaggerating how long it takes to research it. A focused crew can get it pretty quickly, and if its a guaranteed method for mush detection I think a lot of ships will prioritize rushing it. If its researched early the damage really isn't anything you have to worry about. I think the 1ap to use it an 2ap to heal is hardly going to deter crews from using if its a guaranteed way to find mush.

I think this will lead to it getting rushed on a lot of ships, then the majority of mush are forced to either die or go on a rampage doing as mush damage as possible. Which is okay once in a while, but I think the game is funnest when you have to actually investigate and catch the mush. I find it boring as both mush and humans if you just research something then push a button and find the mush.
On december 10, 2013
[1384452]
CalibIf anything I think hitting a Mush should result in a FREAK OUT. Something like dealing 5 damage to everyone in the room and wiping that cycle's logs from the room records. It just turns it blank in the records.

That might be interesting, but it could be weaponized as well. Why carry a grenade when you could spore suck yourself?

Maybe it could be a one time thing?

Maybe it could have the side effect of actually sporing everyone in the room instead of causing damage as well as having a spore in hand? Having a device that actually sucks spores out can't turn out well. It would directly expose the person as mush so it would be a last resort kind of thing. They might be able to catch one mush with it, but a second try risks getting the room converted to mush.

Or people might keep a minimal number of testers in the room, leading to false witnesses. Most of the active mush hunters often get targeted by mush anyway and the backlash might be the last spore to convert them.
On december 10, 2013
[7896920]

I like the idea of it infecting everyone in the room when used on a mush. That would force crews to be real careful who they use it on.

But I get the impression that the spore sucker should be an alternative/last resort for spore removal if the soap or chun is gone and you cannot create the mushicide soap. I have a hard time believing it was intended as a mush detection tool.
On december 10, 2013
Calib
MrMuz

That might be interesting, but it could be weaponized as well. Why carry a grenade when you could spore suck yourself?

Maybe it could be a one time thing?

Maybe it could have the side effect of actually sporing everyone in the room instead of causing damage as well as having a spore in hand?

A one-time freak out effect would make more sense. It also would encourage Mush to go along with being tested, which gives them another defense. Sporing everyone in the room (no message) would work, though it should only do that the first time the mush is hit. The only problem with spores coming out is then you just give Chun some armor and send her in as witness. There needs to be more of a risk.

Maybe it could be a random effect that does either depending on the dice! Did it just hurt the Mush? Do they freak out and hurt everyone, blanking the room log in the process? Does the sucker get a whole LOT of spores and spore everyone? Much more interesting than "nothing", actually risky to Chun, and it makes people take the Spore Sucker more seriously.
On december 10, 2013
[1419839]

Honestly, I really don't think it's that powerful. There is so. much. work. involved in using it. You need to synchronize activity, be online at the same time, force the mush to actively incriminate themselves. You need multiple witnesses or you can't trust the results (or for Chun to manage it) It's man advantage is DEFINITELY as a scare tactic more than anything else. It's also risky - clear someone with the spore sucker, and then everyone trusts them. That means they are prime targets for being turned or transferred.

The "best case scenario" really is the Mush panicking and rampaging. Because them not being where they need to be, or leaving the room after using it (to secretly take a shower) claming they thought it was done... all the normal Mush strategies of covering up aggressive activity with incompetence, inactivity, or an off cycle time online still works just as well.

Personally, I see it as a last line of defense sort of thing. Think about it for a minute. Say you have a Mush Paola. She knows the only thing she needs to do to insure a Mush victory is be a contributing member of the team. That's seriously it! She never gets dirty, and thus has no excuse to shower. Things like the forced dirty test, the spore sucker, the spoiled food test - against certain types of Mush, these things are neccesary. They are also incredibly unwieldy and quite risky as well.

I don't think it's as much of a golden bullet as it seems - the real benefit comes from making your Mush think it is.

That said, I'd approve of giving Mush some sort of freak-out ability in response to using it. But I'm okay with an item that sooner or later prompts mush to action, instead of allowing them to win by helping the crew effectively succeed and never doing anything Mushy.
On december 10, 2013
[1384452]

True, it does bring in a lot of drama, which is what I like about it. Especially since it's not guaranteed to make people dirty and requires several painful attempts to prove with some people.

It's incredibly difficult to screen the whole ship. It's normally just to certify a few suspects. But as it is, it's still safer than all the other mush testing tactics.

I don't think it's a great thing to have as your first research, because neglecting antispore/constipaspore gives mush way too much of a head start. Maybe the research cost of spore sucker could be increased by 30% or so, to give them more head start. I don't think the spore sucker was designed as a much hunting tool so a higher research cost would reflect its usefulness.

I just think that it's overpowered as a mush detection tool. It should have a few more drawbacks. Maybe giving a sickness or freak out ability would balance it. Or even if it uses up 2 AP... giving the mush an excuse to rest before preparing for a rampage.

I do think it would be hilarious even if it did nothing for mush but let them extract free spores though or use it to extract spores in secret without getting dirty, just anything where you have to give it to the mush to test them but at the same time the mush getting it is actually dangerous got the ship. A double edged sword that other research can blunt (like antispore gas) but still not perfect.

On december 10, 2013
[2395583]

I'm still wanting a in-game-to-account-anonymous-notification pager function.

For example, click on the person (or a walkie-talkie) and have a button which says "page". click the button, select a character, and it will log in the room as "character-so-and-so paged character-so-and-so". The account playing the character will receive a generic message in their notification area for each page so they see it when they log in like this: "character-so-and-so from your mush game paged you, they desperately need your help!"

that way both character-player anonymity is preserved, and a way to attempt to contact more inactive players is available. this will not prevent inactives, which i understand are an intended part of the game, but it will serve as a reminded for those who just forgot or became busy, and give the active players SOMETHING they can do about it other than gripe at the developers. ^^

On december 13, 2013
TradeFederation

[SUGGESTION] Create a title 'second in command', and let them move the ship just like the captain, but not issue missions. This would pretty much end the 'kill the noob/less-than-active captain' events, that have been occurring a lot on my ships lately, and it would make the skill Opportunist a suck a little less.

Second in command would move down the line of sucession for captain, so it would start with Chao, and if the captain dies/full inacto, Chao becomes captain, and Second in command moves down to the next person in line. If the second in command dies, that title alone moves down, its like Vice President, or Riker on Star Trek TNG, that way, there would be someone on standby that expects to take command, if needed. This would save so much trouble in this game, because most players cant be online all the time, now there will likely be one of them online reasonably soon after an emergency need arises.
On december 13, 2013
Sagittaeri
TradeFederation[SUGGESTION] Create a title 'second in command', and let them move the ship just like the captain, but not issue missions. This would pretty much end the 'kill the noob/less-than-active captain' events, that have been occurring a lot on my ships lately, and it would make the skill Opportunist a suck a little less.

Second in command would move down the line of sucession for captain, so it would start with Chao, and if the captain dies/full inacto, Chao becomes captain, and Second in command moves down to the next person in line. If the second in command dies, that title alone moves down, its like Vice President, or Riker on Star Trek TNG, that way, there would be someone on standby that expects to take command, if needed. This would save so much trouble in this game, because most players cant be online all the time, now there will likely be one of them online reasonably soon after an emergency need arises.

Alternatively, allow a Delegate action. So if a Captain of the ship knows he's going to be inactive for the next 5-6 crucial cycles, he can "delegate" his title down to someone at most three in-line (living) down from him. The title held by this person who got delegated is then the Acting Captain. As long as an Acting Captain exists, the actual Captain won't be able to do any Captain-y things. However, he can revoke the delegation at any time so he can start doing Captain-y things again.

I believe this would be cool, as it forces the title-holder to choose carefully who they can trust their title to, if they ever need to delegate. Chun is so far down the list in all three titles, that I'm certain we won't have an issue of everyone delegating titles to Chun. This also encourages mush to gain trust from humans, to gain access to these titles (assuming they're the sabotaging kind).
On december 13, 2013
lordwok

Hi folks
I am wondering about the reasoning behind having people who have never played before do their tutorial on "live" ships instead of a separate tutorial area....

the amount of character slots that get wasted by people who turn the game on, get partway through the tutorial and realize its not for them and then screw over an actual live game by just never coming back again is absurd.......

why is this even a thing? who thought this was a good idea??

i would like to buy some gold days but paying to play this game is simply not going to happen while the game is in its current state, i dont think ive had a game yet where every single player is actually being controlled by a human being, there is no castings on the english version (why?) so you cant get around this problem that way...

Mush: really good concept, terrible execution frankly

kloonej

I want to point one of mechanics of the game - MPs. I assume that those two factors (AP and MP) corresponds strictly to time. So I know it`s a foundation of game but I really can`t stand that I have some spare MP (which I believe simply corresponds to TIME I have, same as AP) and not even a single AP regarding to stay and work in one place for X cycles. That means IRL I could make a TEA for myself and have free time to clean a toilet, but can`t do because - don`t know about the others but - I have this shitty toilet in bathroom. I can`t move... what the hell? I almost see those colonies of germs inventing wheel, gun powder, then antibiotics and finally they make whole human population extincts due to My physical indolence.

I believe player should have both AP and MP, but only fine calculated amount of AP should be regained in cycle change. Then if You investing some time to traveling, just changing one AP to X MP and everything is almost cool. Almost because while converts 1AP to 3MP and needed only 1MP during cycle it means waste of 2/3 AP time. I assure You if I only think more about it I could found some nice explanation, if don`t always could say it`s less of two evils.

Did I miss something, or it really is as simple and anticipated as described?

On december 13, 2013
[7922882]
lordwok

Hi folks
I am wondering about the reasoning behind having people who have never played before do their tutorial on "live" ships instead of a separate tutorial area....

the amount of character slots that get wasted by people who turn the game on, get partway through the tutorial and realize its not for them and then screw over an actual live game by just never coming back again is absurd.......

why is this even a thing? who thought this was a good idea??

i would like to buy some gold days but paying to play this game is simply not going to happen while the game is in its current state, i dont think ive had a game yet where every single player is actually being controlled by a human being, there is no castings on the english version (why?) so you cant get around this problem that way...

Mush: really good concept, terrible execution frankly

According to mods the developers intend for inactives to be part of "the mush experience". Thus there will never be 'newbie station', tutorials will always be on live ships and inactives and regular players will never be separated unless the regular players PAY to use castings.

I think one reason is because if they separated or minimized the impact of inactives, people would waste fewer gold days. Fewer gold days wasted means fewer bought. Grabbing that cash is the most important thing to the developers at the end of the day.
On december 13, 2013
psibertus

kloonej You can regenerate 2 AP per cycle in a bed (in most cases) so that is potentially
7 MP per cycle. you seriously complaining about that?
On december 14, 2013
Delzoup
Vector

According to mods the developers intend for inactives to be part of "the mush experience". Thus there will never be 'newbie station', tutorials will always be on live ships and inactives and regular players will never be separated unless the regular players PAY to use castings.

I think one reason is because if they separated or minimized the impact of inactives, people would waste fewer gold days. Fewer gold days wasted means fewer bought. Grabbing that cash is the most important thing to the developers at the end of the day.

No, inactives hurt gold day use. Having people play for as many days in a row as possible is best for Twinoid - and when they die to dive right back in again & use up what they have. Instead, people are waiting days and weeks to do Mushdays and MMMs to attempt to minimize the impact of innactive characters, which means their gold days last longer between payments.
On december 14, 2013
Delzoup

Seconded.

Instead, people are waiting days and weeks to do Mushdays and MMMs to attempt to minimize the impact of innactive characters, which means their gold days last longer between payments.

Actually when you start a new ship, a day is used up right away. So starting a bunch of new ships still burns through gold days. You are right about MMM though.

back to what i was actually talking about:

the tutorial players being placed on "live" ships, this is a really bad idea... like remarkably bad.... and i dont see why they would do this as it ruins the game for alot of people who then quit playing , this is not good business so the argument that this makes MT more money falls flat. i havent played a HUGE number of ships perhaps 10-15? but i would say that a large proportion of the proper inactives i have come across are new players that dont finish the tutorial. ( usually easy to spot because they find hidden walkie talkies, starve before you should be able to etc )

regarding the english language version being in a different stage of development then the english version: this is quite strange, obviously since more people speak english then french the english language version will have a greater market then the french one ever will, the game is sold over the internet so distribution/marketing issues dont apply and the only localization issue is the language the text is in. its just bad business to focus on a smaller market while leaving another market with a great deal more potential customers waiting..... besides how hard is it to make two carbon copys of the same game and simply have the text translated?????????

i cant understand why they have a picture of a sofa in the forward bravo turret yet when you build the sofa on bridge instead of just copy pasteing this image into the room and adding some functionality when it's clicked, they put a square box with "sofa" written on it in with the shelf rofl.......

dont get me wrong i really like MT and some of the quirky original games they have made like die2nite but whoever is in charge of making some of these bizarre decisions really needs to be asked some hard questions........................

On december 16, 2013
Rain
lordwokoh and i think we all know who is hiding behind the anonymous moderator message and nitpicking because i used 5 emoticon faces and a word which simply means stunted development, i would hardly call that word offensive, rude or profane.

Not to derail here, but as someone who works in the mental health field and cares about several individuals with developmental disabilities, I can tell you that use of the term 'retard' or 'retarded' is definitely considered offensive and hurtful. It is used as slang for someone or something that is stupid or lesser, and it is also linked with intellectual and developmental disabilities. You yourself say that it means stunted development, but in the context you initially used it, it clearly seems to mean stupid. I say this not to shame or imply that you're a bad person or whatnot, as I do assume that, like many people, you simply haven't given this word much thought. But I do feel that education on the matter is important.

A good site with explanation: http://www.r-word.org/r-word-effects-...
On december 16, 2013
Sagittaeri

Thanks for that, Rain. I absolutely agree that some words could be hurtful to people even when we don't mean it that way.

I gotta say, however, that I'm pretty proud at MT players for its lack of discriminatory slurs in comparison to other gaming communities. The amount of homophobia, sexism and racism is quite astounding (in a shameful way) among mainstream gaming communities.

...and yes, back to topic now. XD

This doesn't have to be "part of the game." It could easily be fixed by adding (or even replacing the current tutorial with) some information (or a tutorial) that's entirely separate from the normal ships, and new players can read (or play through) before they pick characters and join ships at all.

[7897790]

I know that probably all of these were mentioned before, but I feel that I have to write this down after a long and successfull voyage.
Eff the RNG. Seriously. I know it is luck based. I know it is random and you take what you get. But when on my last ship, multiple people scanning turned up only volcanoes... and that's okay, it's bad luck. We didn't even had Mush to be afraid of, it was only the RandomNumberGenerator against us.

But holy moly did it step up things after day 10. I wrote on the AP, and I still stand by it that between Day 10-11 we instantly got more bad luck than all the other days combined. I know that this must be the breaking point where the game just goes hardcore, but getting no scans, new hunters almost every even cycle (and breakage but that's okay) was just too strong. We did everything, and I do mean everything an active 6-8 people can do and even with the plasma shield it was way too risky as all our resources drained in an instant. If someone slept for a day and returned to this, we could tell him that Shr√∂dringer was a lord of destruction and he woud see why.

I could go on that why do new ships start at day 2 with punctured hull if they started with no pilots yet, essentially shortening the timespan where we can "rest and prepare" for what's to come, but I think everyone has their opinion on that.
On december 17, 2013
TradeFederation

Default BIOS settings : food is destroyed, Plasma shield off, Magnetic net off.


I suggest these Default BIOS selections all be inverted, because 99.9 % of the time you don't want them in their initial states. I almost think these settings are intentionally set to stupid choices, to give the NERON Admin something important to do right after the ship is full, but the net result of this is that, combined with bad tooltips that tell new player Stephen to cook lots of food right away, the BIOS often has all your newly cooked food destroyed in 1-2 cycles, before anyone can eat it, and this is REALLY ANNOYING, and completely avoidable. Even if Janice is online and sees what's happening, you can't actually change BIOS until that last person joins, and that is usually right after the first day change, so its too late for the first batch of cooked food Also, because there is no cost to the ship to using the Plasma Shield and Magnetic net, there is almost no reason you would ever want them off. I have killed a Mush by moving the ship intentionally when they outside, in a patrol ship, and i would need the magnetic net off for that, but for the life of me, I cannot think of a single reason I would EVER want a newly built plasma shield set to 'off', unless i was a Mush, and why would the initial default BIOS setting of that project be in a Mush desired setting ?

On december 17, 2013
TradeFederation
RainRe plasma shield: Perhaps so that a mush NERON admin can delay and keep it off while the ship takes damage without blowing their cover entirely? If it was default on, turning it off would be glaringly obvious sabotage, not so with being 'inactive' or 'not noticing' when it needs to be turned on.

I actually agree with you, that the initial BIOS setting is a glaringly obvious and natural Mush Sabotagportunity, but for a ship project as huge as the Plasma Shield, it is just not gonna be a solo build effort of NERON AdminiMush, so I don't see why the default setting should be a completely illogical and nonsensical choice, for no other reason than just to ramp up in-game stress. As a first-time NERON admin, I actually didn't realize I had to turn it on, and wasted a cycle with the ship getting shot, just because I was sleeping when the shield was finally finished. Not unlike having no backup Captain, it just makes no sense to delay such an absolutely critical decision for half a day, just for someone to come online, when EVERYONE (that is human) on the ship knows exactly what needs to be done...

ScoutMotion Twin has a pretty clear vision on the matter.I don't believe this vision is anything close to clear.

No, actually, they have a vision, which I've laid out. But, here we go again - it is that in their multiplayer games your fellow players are unpredictable and it's a form of game play to work with, around or in spite of them. Just like the RNG in any other game mechanic.

I am asking you one last time to stop insulting the game and developers and stop repeating this same sentiment. It's been expressed, it's well known, really.
On december 22, 2013
Sulik

New experience system suggestion.

Currently we get 1 XP per cycle (double if Gold) no matter what, my suggestion is to depend experience gain on game advancement (also double it for Gold).
On day 1, 1XP on cycles 4 and 8
On day 2, 2XP on cycles 4 and 8
On day 3, 3XP on cycles 4 and 8
On day 4, 4XP on cycles 4 and 8
...
and so on.

This will encourage players not to give up in nearly hopeless situations (there are no truly hopeless situations in mush).

Also to reward with some XP by winning the game, not only glory.
On december 24, 2013
[1306060]

I disagree rather strongly with the above, mostly because it heavily penalizes people who get stuck on low activity or uncommunicative/disorganized ships. I think the current system works quite well to encourage people to not give up; the suggestion system would likely just engender frustration, particularly if you happen to be, say, d5c7, and there's not way to eke out that final cycle.

On day 4, 4XP on cycles 4 and 8
...
and so on.

Also to reward with some XP by winning the game, not only glory.
This will encourage players not to give up in nearly hopeless situations (there are no truly hopeless situations in mush).

XP farming by being inactive is incredibly tedious, especially if you aren't a Gold member and who is going to play Gold and then go inactive to farm XP? XP farming is a perceived problem that's not happening. Inactive players usually just stop playing after a couple of ships.

Instead of finding solutions for less XP for certain people, solutions to manage on a ship without a Comms officer or a Morale booster might be time better spent.
On december 24, 2013
[7915070]

ScoutXP farming by being inactive is incredibly tedious, especially if you aren't a Gold member

What's so tedious about it? There's no effort involved, all you have to do is eat every three days and check if anything/anyone killed you. If you're dead, join a new ship and keep farming. Whether you're gold or not doesn't make any difference at all, you gain XP at the same speed either way regardless of whether you're doing anything or just idling. I can certainly see doing it to level up a character or two if the ship I'm on doesn't seem worth the effort.
On december 24, 2013
Annette

What's tedious about it is you are paying for a game, month on end, to slowly build XP, it's boring not to mention very expensive XP. As a non Gold player, logging on and idling until you gain XP to actually get that one skill you're doing it for would be tedious because it would take a great deal of time. Not just days spent doing nothing whether you are paying or not, continually confirming you death and rejumping would because boring. Most people would and do lose interest.

[7915070]

No, it's been repeatedly stated that inactivity is not punished in any way. It's not counted as harming the ship, but as neutral. Even if you wanted to make some distinction between "innocent" and "malicious" idling, it's an impossible idea because you can't prove intent like that.

And Scout just keeps repeating he doesn't mind inactives but hates quitters who give up on ships they don't like. Since quitting generally takes the form of going inactive, I don't see how that makes any sense. The best way to punish the quitters would be to stop them from getting XP after they go idle.
On december 25, 2013
npfan
AnaonNo, it's been repeatedly stated that inactivity is not punished in any way. Even if you wanted to make some distinction between "innocent" and "malicious" idling, it's an impossible idea because you can't prove intent like that.

The SDF has ways of detecting malicious idling...

AnaonAnd Scout just keeps repeating he doesn't mind inactives but hates quitters who give up on ships they don't like. Since quitting generally takes the form of going inactive, I don't see how that makes any sense. The best way to punish the quitters would be to stop them from getting XP after they go idle.

There are some people who quit by committing suicide or provoking the team to kill him, both of which are against the rules. If someone admits to going inactive because they quit, that is also sanctionable. Of course, if someone goes inactive without a clear reason why, there is always a benefit of the doubt given since there shouldn't be a presumption of guilt. A game mechanic to prevent XP farming would be nice, but if you see clear evidence of someone farming XP, feel free to report that person.

[7971963]

I'm just saying from my experiences so far on both sides, Inactives are far less interesting/fun to deal with than people that act. Even the ones that drive you bonkers. (Most Jin Su's)

On a totally unrelated note, it would be neat to have an item/blueprint for an in-game item that functions similar to the Thermos of Coffee.

Example Concept:
Portable Thermos
-The ideal mode of preserving and serving Coffee to the crew!

-Random Blueprint (OR, 50% chance instead of a Sofa)
-Cost: 4Plastic Scrap, 2Metal Scrap
OR
-Cost: 1 Thick Tube, x2 Metal Scrap

Initial Charges : 0
Max Charges: 4

Actions
*Add Coffee (0AP)
-Consumes a non-spoiled and non-frozen Coffee Object to add a charge to the Thermos.
*Remove Coffee (0AP)
-Uses a charge to create a Coffee Object.
*Heat Coffee (0AP)
-Converts a super-frozen coffee to a normal coffee.

Special
*All Actions that involve Coffee or the Coffee Machine cannot make you dirty while in inventory.

While it would initially be (significantly) weaker than a bed, the ability to cart around a grand total of 6 coffees and NOT get dirty from drinking them could make this a very powerful late-game item for AP generation. Probably an instant favorite of Gieoele players!

Possibly a little too powerful. The idea is that it has a fairly high opportunity cost (Either a TON of early scrap, which can be used for the hull/drones/etc or your sofa) for a late-game powerhouse item.

On december 30, 2013
Gimboid

Suggestion If on a cycle change, a character is already inactive, the player with the least AP/MP will instead receive a bonus. If there are multiple inactive, then their points are shared out amongst those with the least AP/MP

Example:
- Stephen, Terrance and Ian are inactive
- Janice 2/1, Raluca 0/4, Chun 5/5, Paola 5/0
- No one is in bed
- Cycle Changes
- Janice gets her 1/1, plus a bonus 1/1 so is now at 4/3
- Raluca gets her 1/1, plus a bonus 1/1 so is now at 2/6
- Paola gets her 1/1, plus a bonus 1/1 so is now at 7/2

This should help balance out for inactive crew and if 4 people have gone off and s topped playing, the dozens of lost AP/MP can still benefit the ship

On january 10, 2014
[7876236]
Andreguess so and the Pilgred points i think should be 2AP then the nexus points daily will give you 2AP and 2MP while the pilgred points give 2AP

My conversion suggestion was made on the usefulness of the skill prior to being useless.
So 2 a day were equal to 4 AP
and 1 was equal to 2 AP.
Meaning the nexus points gave more daily AP.

Now, after they become useless, they shouldn't be converted to their equal number of AP because their use was limited. Thus, in my opinion converting 2 to just 1 AP and 1 MP is fair enough, because you can use that 1 AP wherever you like.

Same for the point. You get 1 = 2 AP a day, meaning lower usefulness thus lower conversion rate, just 1 AP and no MP.
