On january 10, 2014
JD_Ender

I would like to suggest a new fighter stance/Action for Patrol Ships: Power Nap

Credit goes to NickBoom for suggesting this as a perk in a different thread, but I would like to expand on it a bit, now that I have some small experience as a pilot. Would this work with balancing? (or something like it)

Power Nap: would be a free action (otherwise it would defeat the point) you could perform while flying, It would be similar to Bait, where any enemy ships would target you, only they would have a 100% chance to hit, and maybe even do extra damage.

You would only be able to perform this once per flight, and you would only nap for 1 cycle, giving you 2 AP.

Basically just enough to get you landed. It could be made as a gamble even: risking Hunters ambushing next round to get back on the Daedalus asap.
On january 11, 2014
[7971963]

Some idle thoughts for level 6 abilities for characters that lack them. Please note, all of these are designed to be used for silver/gold players, not bronze.


Kuan Ti - "Daedalus' Blueprints"
-Once per day, Kuan Ti may "Reshuffle" the existing Neron projects. All currently selected projects are placed back into the pool and three new projects are selected. All progress on projects thus far are lost.
-If Mush: Kept

A powerful ability, for both sides, Blueprints would help reinforce Kaun Ti's role as primary NERON researcher. That said, it is heavily dependent on luck!


Paola - "Daddy's Girl"
-Once per day Paola may "Hug" Gioele for 1 AP (Replaces flirt). This act gives both of them +1 Morale
-If Mush: Kept

More of a flavorful ability, nevertheless it gives Paola and Gioele a fairly accessible source of morale. assuming they both stay alive long enough to take advantage of it.


Chun - "Martyr"
-When Chun dies, all human crew members are informed of their current spore count and given 1 AP.

Chun is often a mush target. For those times when you doubt you are going to make it, it becomes a last hurrah against the Mush team.


Finola - "Tidy"
-Sometimes-dirty actions have a substantially lower chance of making someone dirty if they are in the same room as Finola. (50-75% reduced chance to get dirty by sometimes-dirty actions). Reduces the chance of always-dirty actions by 25%. Never applies to Finola herself.

If Mush: Kept

Matches Finola's cleanliness focus, and gives a high-level finola mush a little more flexibility/utility.


Raluca - "Recluse"
-After 8 cycles of avoiding contact of any kind with others, Raluca gains an additional +1 AP/cycle. This is reset if she ever shares a room with another player, even if they do not stay in the room after a cycle change.

If Mush: Lost

Raluca is already designed to be away from everyone else, this skill capitalizes on that by giving her a small bonus if she avoids the rest of the crew for a full day.


Eleesha - "Publication"
-Whenever Eleesha personally finishes a project, rebel base, research, or PILGRED she gains 3AP and 1 Morale.

If Mush: Lost

Eleesha is already something of a jack of all trades after the mush hunt is over. Technician and IT specialist allow her to branch out in all sorts of interesting ways. Publication capitalizes on this by giving her AP whenever she successfully completes a task that helps the crew.


Naturally these are clearly totally unbalanced and crazy, but that's part of the fun isn't it?

Allow players to ping a crewmate with a button. This ping will send the player a Twinoid private message, so the player will receive a notification on their phone or while they're playing other MT games.

On january 20, 2014
[7899692]

Some of these suggestions are excellent. I do think there's room for Twinoid to expand on the skill sets of some characters. It's just not fair, that some have Lvl6 skills and others do not. I especially like the Kuan Ti one since he's my favourite hero.

All your other suggestions make sense as well, and fit into the existing lore. Thumbs up!

Some idle thoughts for level 6 abilities for characters that lack them. Please note, all of these are designed to be used for silver/gold players, not bronze.

Kuan Ti - "Daedalus' Blueprints"
-Once per day, Kuan Ti may "Reshuffle" the existing Neron projects. All currently selected projects are placed back into the pool and three new projects are selected. All progress on projects thus far are lost.
-If Mush: Kept

A powerful ability, for both sides, Blueprints would help reinforce Kaun Ti's role as primary NERON researcher. That said, it is heavily dependent on luck!

Paola - "Daddy's Girl"
-Once per day Paola may "Hug" Gioele for 1 AP (Replaces flirt). This act gives both of them +1 Morale
-If Mush: Kept

More of a flavorful ability, nevertheless it gives Paola and Gioele a fairly accessible source of morale. assuming they both stay alive long enough to take advantage of it.

Chun - "Martyr"
-When Chun dies, all human crew members are informed of their current spore count and given 1 AP.

Chun is often a mush target. For those times when you doubt you are going to make it, it becomes a last hurrah against the Mush team.

Finola - "Tidy"
-Sometimes-dirty actions have a substantially lower chance of making someone dirty if they are in the same room as Finola. (50-75% reduced chance to get dirty by sometimes-dirty actions). Reduces the chance of always-dirty actions by 25%. Never applies to Finola herself.

If Mush: Kept

Matches Finola's cleanliness focus, and gives a high-level finola mush a little more flexibility/utility.

Raluca - "Recluse"
-After 8 cycles of avoiding contact of any kind with others, Raluca gains an additional +1 AP/cycle. This is reset if she ever shares a room with another player, even if they do not stay in the room after a cycle change.

If Mush: Lost

Raluca is already designed to be away from everyone else, this skill capitalizes on that by giving her a small bonus if she avoids the rest of the crew for a full day.

Eleesha - "Publication"
-Whenever Eleesha personally finishes a project, rebel base, research, or PILGRED she gains 3AP and 1 Morale.

If Mush: Lost

Eleesha is already something of a jack of all trades after the mush hunt is over. Technician and IT specialist allow her to branch out in all sorts of interesting ways. Publication capitalizes on this by giving her AP whenever she successfully completes a task that helps the crew.
On january 20, 2014

I think MT should do more of what they are doing. They are doing a damn good job!

On january 21, 2014
[7899399]

I'm going to repost this here from another thread because this is where it belongs apparently

Games can always be improved, so I hope the development team considers some of these changes. A really interesting game mechanic would be to introduce electrical power. This is a spaceship after all. If a room has a camera, it's pretty much safe right now. But if mush could choose to sabotage an electrical relay for a part of the ship, they could temporarily disable the cameras, work stations, etc. in a given area. That would make it possible to obfuscate the room logs and would keep the human players even more on their toes as they are truly not safe anywhere. Power settings could be controlled in the bios, with a choice to redirect power to parts of the ship to give an efficiency boost to console related activities in parts of the ship as well. This would benefit the humans as well! I think it's a really basic concept such as oxygen and fuel that every spaceship needs, but has been overlooked for now. It would be great to put this in and add to the realism and game options in my opinion! Let me know what you all think!

It would also help offset the loss of players or inactives. I'm playing a game where we got rid of mushy Paola and Frieda is afk. So it's amazingly hard to keep up with those duties. Power boosts would I think also alleviate your biggest complaint, that of inactives on ships without going against what the developers want for the game. It would allow ships to get past the losses of vital crewmembers, although it wouldn't completely make up for it. And it gives the mush more options as well so it's not heavy handed. Plus, I just want to see the lights go out like in horror movies so they can flicker back on revealing a dead crew member and ramp up the suspense!

I was thinking the power substations could also be used to send a power surge that will overload the circuits, possibly causing fires along the electrical lines path. There are endless options for it! Nexus projects that better regulate energy efficiency, a dampener that would prevent harmful power surges. You could introduce the concept of energy use, for example plasma shields would eat up a lot of energy, dismantler none. One of the characters who don't have 6 levels of skills could have a new skill, Electrician.

Also it's the most constructive way I've heard of so far to bridge the gap between the developers vision and the thing players hate most about the game, inactives.
On january 21, 2014
UncleNature

-Electrical power... Interesting...

-Inactive players are part of the game, fed up of reading people b*tching about it MT have said they wont change it, deal with it.

On january 28, 2014
JD_Ender

I would like to make a suggestion for a disease change, I think it would be lots of fun

*Black Bite*

Right now black bite is very under-documented, It sounds pretty terrifying but it only gives a 10% chance to lose 1 AP each cycle... kind of lame really.

Suggestion: Upon contracting black bite, every cycle change you will randomly bite one crew member in the same room as you, this does 1-3 damage, and carries a 50-75% (needs balancing) chance to infect the bitten crewmate with black bite. If they are already infected, this would strengthen the illness, and/or cause damage. This should be a really tough one to cure. Imagine the fun we would have!

kloonej

now seriously!

What You think about rewriting chat to be more d2n-ish? I mean, each room should have it`s own chat which holds all messages by deafult, then actual chat (as talkie) should be some sort of global chat with restrictions. I might seem crazy, but it`s not usual for Me when 16 persons walks allover the ship and talk to this damn radio even if they are face2face.

this sort of chatrooms, could hold messages for each player from his enter to quit the room ingame. If he quit only other participants who stayed could get this history - if everyone left everything is lost, then only Eleesha (or maybe new skill like wiretapping) could get trace of those chats.

global chat (talkie) could have some restrictions - due to motion in ether - maybe 2-3 texts per cycle? or string length restriction (this one is unpractical). Third sort of restriction could be very harmful but funny, if someone abuse GC his messages could mix randomly with other random message in GC.

this feature could give some more real like feeling and turn up ploting and spying atmosphere on ship.

I don`t take arguments like: We already in 21st century texting via various sorts of devices while still are face to face or in the same room

Ideas for skills
Kuan Ti Skill- Rivalry
Once per day Kuan Ti can view another player's Glory (number only). He can only view each persons' once per ship.

For 2 AP Paola can "do that other thing" to any male player to give him 3 morale but she gains "Full" status
Ian- Vaporiser
Whilst in Hydrpoinc Garden Ian can use "Use Vaporizer" to gain double AP for 6 cycles, however anything he does makes him dirty, even if he uses apron and he becomes starving at the end of the 6th cycle
Eleesha- Transcript
At any point Eleesha can produce a transcript of any room logs in the form of a document. This action costs 4AP
Finola- Observant
Because OCD people notice stuff

It's not that MT doesn't listen to international players' opinions, they don't listen to opinions in general unless it's really meaningful.
On february 6, 2014
ringhloth
npfanIt's not that MT doesn't listen to international players' opinions, they don't listen to opinions in general unless it's really meaningful.

Which is true of most game studios. Look at any other game forum, and you'll see a similar situation. It's probably quite rare when a player suggests something the dev team hasn't thought of already and ruled out. Even rarer when it's actually possible to do in the game engine. And, rarest of all, when it's actually a good idea and fits the development plans.
On february 6, 2014
[7922882]

npfan & ringloth are right.

Unless it involves a way to earn the company more profit then it's usually ignored.

On february 9, 2014
Vince
JiNXeD

The current one that we're up against is guarding Bravo Bay, has Plastenite Armor and has hid all weapons in the Center Bravo Storage. This is so annoying..

Oh, and in addition, he has Hard Boiled, which lowers sustained damage by 1 point. So we basically do about -1 to 0 damage. 1 damage if we're extremely lucky.

Yeah usually you can solve this by one-shot critting him with weapons, especially with shooter points which go right through his Pacifist skill. But as agewisdom said: Grenades might still do 1-10 damage as always. After dropping two of those you might be able to finish him off, though it would still take a lot of AP.

If he also has all the grenades and all the blueprints, and important items... well. Then you should probably ask yourself how that could happen. Did he have any help?

In that case any attempt to attack, while tempting, would indeed be a huge waste, as he can just Phagocyte and heal up. I would just work around him as best as possible... Remember that he also cannot do much while guarding, and just walking up to people and spiking them, while possible, costs 3 AP for him as well. So get a Spore Sucker to counter this (and stay under cameras!), find the other mush and go for the Serum. While you can't kill him, you could still cure him!

On february 11, 2014
Darkfirephoenix

I got some Ideas for Mush skills (who would make it even more fun):
1. Clean and Hidden extraction of spores
2. "Human" digestive system (meaning you can eat and get Ap like a Human from food)
3. "Human" immune system (you can get sick like a Human, but won't suffer from the bad stuff [no Ap loss and so on] but will still get the statuses like vomitting)

This would give the Mush the chance to be even more sneaky and hidden. I would think these skills should then be only avaiable at lvl. 19, 20 and 21 for balance purposes.

I have an idea too for a possible new char (the devs should decide about his name) :
A male person who could be choosen instead of Chun, is SUPER social (looses 1 Morale for every cycle WITHOUT someone else in the room and can even counteract against Ralucas Antisocial) and has an even more amazing unique body: He assimilates every Virus, Bacteria and other Parasites (can NEVER get sick and is immune to the Mush) and heals every day 4 Health points
Possible skills:
Mankind's only Hope (like Chun)
Medic
Expert for Artifial Beings and Life: Like Terrence Robotics Expert, IT Expert and NERON's only friend (he get's 2 points to work on Robots/Drones)
All around Genius: works like Technician, Botanist, Biologst, Pilot, Astrophysicist and Physicist, has special points to spend for these tasks
Above the limit: He can push his body and Mind over the limits of "normal" Humans: He gets 16 Ap, is fully healed, get's +2 attack, can work on Projects and Research without efficency loss BUT it will only last 1 cycle, once per ship, give him the status "starving", he'll loose half his health after it wears of and it can only be used when there are only 6 Humans left
Maybe someone can think of a story for him?

These are, of course, only suggestions and could get changed to keep the balance.
On february 11, 2014
Darkfirephoenix

I thought about a little story for him:
He was born in 1989. He lost his parents at the age of 2 and got into an orphanage where they discovered his Genius and superhuman capabilitys. This got him put into an (half) secret Research program to "enhance" Humans (by studying his body and genetics) but he was allowed to learn how he wanted. He developed radikal and ground breaking Theorys which never got public. With the age of 8 he got his first doctor title, with the age of 10 he got his first professor title and held at least 1 doctor title in EVERY existing subject. With the age of 12 he got professor titles in every subject that exists and at least 4 doctor titles for every subject too. He was put under strict survillance, but one day the Program was disbanded under suspicious circumstances (but nobody recognised this, he himself manipulated the persons behind the project to stop it. How is unknown.) and was "released". He hid as a normal person till he was 24 and got a top secret Space Program. He developed a space ship capable of faster-than-light travel a (still) super modern Cryo-System and a fully functional, self learning AI to travel to one of the nearest stars. Knowing that Humanity wasn't ready for this Technology and what would become of Humanity with this, he decided to destroy and delete all his work around the world within 1 hour and started his voyage alone with his AI (which he named like his ship "Phoenix" ). However there were technical difficultys (because of flawed materials) and he went on an unwanted odyssey. After more than a millenia his ship grounds on a planet in the Tamina system. With the ship greatly damged, Phoenix tries his best to keep his creator alive until one day they are discovered by an expedition force under the Command of Jin Su. Phoenix sends an emergency signal with the left over power and wakes his creator.
To be continued...

On february 12, 2014
Slider2k

Why shooters don't have increased accuracy with guns?
On february 12, 2014
Vince

They do have a higher chance for crits, and a lower chance for accidents... suppose that represetns this.
On february 12, 2014
Slider2k

VinceThey do have a higher chance for crits, and a lower chance for accidents... suppose that represetns this.
Not quite. I haven't noticed that much difference with criticals. And to have a chance at those you need to actually hit the target first, doing which with the same base accuracy as non-shooters feels really bad, considering that the real limiting factor for guns effectiveness in this game is limited charges (i.e. 3-shots with base 50% accuracy makes a blaster pretty useless as a reliable weapon). And what are the real percentages of getting criticals anyway?

For analogy, pilots has double accuracy shooting hunters, than non-pilots. Shooter skill feels weak to me, only good for taking a few pot shots in hoping for a lucky critical. Wrestler on the other hand seems like a much better and more reliable actual combat skill.
On february 12, 2014
Gauteamus

There seems to be some discontention around the issue of glory points being rewarded other than through the natural honour/recognition. In some threads I read suggestions about the number of likes in the game end screen to be the measure of a good performance. On the other hand this ditches the concept of glory altogether, which may be against the desires of the devs.

How about introducing a new combination of glory and likes as the measure of character performance aboard a ship? E.g. one could have a formula like:
Performance = Glory * (#LikesYourCharacterGot - #LikesOfLeastLikedCharacter)
On february 12, 2014
Vince

I do not think likes should replace the glory system, but they should have some influence.

To me it happens frequently that I become the de facto commander of my ships, and try to make them the best they can be. Even if that would mean passing on opportunities to get "my" glory points.
And the crew appreciate it, but the end screen usually looks something like this (On that one I actually was Commander).

In turn, as Ian i am encouraged to let plants die so I can plant more rather than grafting. And while Roland is not the only example (though everyone's favourite), the only thing he has to do to be #1 is sleep all day and shoot hunters whenever they are there - not even communicate. Ideally doing this before a jump instead of after (because there are more!), not really helping, and endangering the rest of the crew who may have to wait around for him to land if they are not selfish enough to just leave him behind.

The point is that the whoie point of the glory system is lost if people laugh at it and agree that those rankings mean nothing. And it does not really encourage good teamplay if actual good teamplay is not really being rewarded.
On february 12, 2014
Vince

If you are going to give for shooting hunters, i.e. people keeping the ship alive or just doing their job, why not also give some for repairing an oxygen tank? For building a sofa? For hacking the navigation terminal and moving the ship, one cycle before it gets hit by asteroids?
On february 12, 2014
Secondary

yes that. I mean come on MT you give one job type a bunch of excess glory why not to the techs, commanders, IT experts and just generalists?
On february 12, 2014
[1820396]

Maybe someone already came with this idea but still:

What about just give some more Glory to people who get likes? Something like "each like = 5 more Glory" in final awards table? I think this wouldn't be terribly hard to implement into the code and seems like the easiest way to make the likes matter in awarding players for good roleplaying or just gameplay.
On february 12, 2014
Vince

I think the idea was that the ship would run OK if everyone is just focusing on their personal objective. However, this leads to problems when some people are missing, which is of course also part of the game.

So here is my actual suggestion:
1) Award glory for actions like the ones mentioned above, which help the whole ship (at least repairing O2).
2) Give some glory for likes.
3) When certain characters go inactive or die, everyone can get some glory for fulfilling their jobs in their place.
E.g. when Frieda dies, others who do scans get "Terra Incognita". When Paola dies, others get glory for finding Kivanc (I think that is actually the case, may be a good bug), etc. This may require some adjustment, but you get the idea.


And @ Belkar
That was the first idea. I like Gauteamus' suggestion of using the difference between "most liked" and "least liked" so people do not just like-spam each other for glory, but yes. That should definitely factor in.

On february 25, 2014
[8142460]

One of the problem of incativity, griefing and bad ships is that you can't really punish bronze players for anything, they have nothing to loose. You can ban thier account, but they will create more. You ban they IP, but every browser have in-build proxy server...

Bronze account is free and the problems of bad behaivior is very serious for all f2p games. Dota 2, League of Legends, World Of Tanks and etc. But they have game mechanics that protect people who invest their time in the game. For dota 2 and lol it's ranked or balance system, they balance you with people of your skill or game number. And higher you are the less bad behavior you will met. Also Riot designed a Level system to protect there players. You must invest a lot of time to get to level 30 and unlock all content of the game. After that if you got banned... you will be sad. That why most toxic moments is from 1-5. For WoT it's leveling, money and crew system.

You game doesn't have such system at all! You doesn't protect you players who invest time and money in your game. And that's sad because this is why you will be loosing them.

You have several ways to resolve that but see this two:

Hard way: You must make a leveling system, with which you can unlock critical roles to a ship step by step. And only after some time of investments get critical roles to a ship. By doing this you are making a developed account to "cost more". So if you ban it... it will be a problem for player. This system encourage players to invest money through: pay money = level up faster.

Easy wave: Bronze players can only play with bronze players. Silver and Gold can play only with each other, no bronze allowed. It will be a hell for f2p players, so you encourage players to pay for leaving hell. And if u ban played account people will loose money.

For now you game is open for hardcore griefing. A will leave and example of hardcore griefing in the next post. So if you find it appropriate you can delete only it. Not whole my post.

I‚Äôm in love with this game, so please do not ban me for that post. I‚Äôm only want to make it better. I played to ship on Mushday both of them have only 5 active people‚Ä¶
On february 25, 2014
[8142460]

One player can create 3-4 accounts, and get them all in one ship taking critical roles.
After that... he can be just idle. Loosing 4 critical roles at start can ruin even PRO ship (with pro mush‚Ä¶).

But what if griefer wants to go nuts? If you know this game a little you can:
1. In one turn with the help of FREE tutorial AP and MP for all 4 characters he can kill another 3-4 critical roles on day 1 before even game starts.
2. After that we can dissemble critical equipment.
3. And loose in space equipment that you can't dissemble...

Now let's presume that it's a group of people who can create from 4-5 account and screw every game during several month. Or targeting MMM or Sunday=Mushday. Making community going crazy because for now it‚Äôs only one play to play this game‚Ä¶ If they loose it‚Ä¶ You will loose players.
I think Competitor Company can even pay for griefing like this... and it wii not be expensive at all. Couse griefers have no need to invest money or time in game‚Ä¶ To screw game for others.
On february 25, 2014
1412

As a free player, I wouldn't mind the hard way you mentioned, but the easy way would be awful. I don't want to be forced to pay for a game to be bearable, which is why I don't play most MMOs. If the system switched to the easy way that you proposed, I would probably leave, and I'd be willing to bet that I wouldn't be alone.
Another note: imagine you're a bronze player trying this game for the first time, and everyone on the ship is either not doing snything or trying to kill you for reasons that remain unsaid. After a first game like that, would you ever consider playing a game like that again? The chance of really bad games goes up drastically if you remove all chances of experienced players who know what they're doing...
On february 25, 2014
[1820396]

donrip, you are forgetting one thing - current game system is very open for new players who want to learn about a game before they put any money into it. And from what I know, mostly people are starting this way, almost nobody puts money into game when they try it first time.

Like 1412 already said, if my first game was a ship full of griefers, inactives and confused newbies I wouldn't be playing it now. It's good thing that on almost every ship are at least two or three experienced players (gold, silver or bronze, this doesn't matter) who know what's going on and are able to help new players get into the game. If all these players were playing on their own ships without n00bs, n00bs wouldn't stay in game. And player base will slowly diminish because - lets face it - even the best game starts being boring and repetitive after few months or years of intensive playing.

Segragating new and experienced players is just a bad thing to do, I hope devs never do this.

Like 1412 already said, if my first game was a ship full of griefers, inactives and confused newbies I wouldn't be playing it now. It's good thing that on almost every ship are at least two or three experienced players (gold, silver or bronze, this doesn't matter) who know what's going on and are able to help new players get into the game. If all these players were playing on their own ships without n00bs, n00bs wouldn't stay in game. And player base will slowly diminish because - lets face it - even the best game starts being boring and repetitive after few months or years of intensive playing.

Segragating new and experienced players is just a bad thing to do, I hope devs never do this.

Then look at Hard way: with that system all critical roles will be occupied by experienced people. Who will command and teach new people. And new players will have great experience because their roles are not so important on the ship. And if they make mistakes nobody will harass them. Also everyone will know that certain roles are going to experienced players (you can even put it into tutorial) and it‚Äôs better to listen to them. So everyone wins!

On march 17, 2014
[7346203]

Suggestion: Terrane's skill Computer scientist could be changed. Instead of giving computer points it would make drones programmable to give the crew more control over them.

Suggested settings:
- The ability to turn on/off upgrades.
- Turbo: Not sure
- Pilot: Prioritize a certain type of hunter. The drone has an increased chance of shooting the particular choice (not 100%)
- Pathfinder: Find the shortest vs the fastest path. Fastest path would be the same as it is now, shortest path would fix any broken doors in the way regardless of the number of cycles it takes to do so.
- Firefighter: Critical signs sensor on/off. When sensor is on, drone exits the room with fire before breaking if the dice decide it's to be broken at cycle change.

Mush play: If Terrace has this skill, mush would be able to hack drones and change settings.
On march 17, 2014

Suggestion: Terrane's skill Computer scientist could be changed. Instead of giving computer points it would make drones programmable to give the crew more control over them.

Suggested settings:
- The ability to turn on/off upgrades.
- Turbo: Not sure
- Pilot: Prioritize a certain type of hunter. The drone has an increased chance of shooting the particular choice (not 100%)
- Pathfinder: Find the shortest vs the fastest path. Fastest path would be the same as it is now, shortest path would fix any broken doors in the way regardless of the number of cycles it takes to do so.
- Firefighter: Critical signs sensor on/off. When sensor is on, drone exits the room with fire before breaking if the dice decide it's to be broken at cycle change.

Mush play: If Terrace has this skill, mush would be able to hack drones and change settings.

On march 17, 2014
[7918569]

Since I'm already here, I might as well throw up some examples of what I'd consider good game design choices.

Mush v1.ividyon changelog:

  • Characters going through the Tutorial now cause a random beneficial item to spawn on the Daedalus.
  • Base efficiency on Antispore Gas lowered to 2-3%.
  • Constipaspore Serum now requires the Mush Reproductive System research before it becomes available.
  • Vending Machine changes:
    • Vendor consumables have been removed from the game.
    • Gold Projects have been converted to regular NERON Projects.
    • Costume and vanity effect parity with the French Mush version.
    • New consumable for 12 Klix: +1 per cycle for the remainder of the ship.
      • Stacks with Gold Mode.
    • The Vending Machine now allows to purchase Gold Days with Klix.
    • The Vending Machine now allows to purchase Tickets with Klix.
  • Gold Days can now be gifted to characters on the ongoing ship.
  • Gold Days can now be gifted in smaller quantities.
  • 1 Klix is now gained every 8 cycles spent in a game.
    • This bonus is disabled when Inactive.
  • New NERON Project: Drone Locator
    • Displays the position of Support Drones on the tracker.
  • New Kuan-Ti skill: Architect (idea inspired by Delzoup)
    • Unique: May build any craftable item without a blueprint. (Still requires material)
  • Gioele: Paranoid is now a Lv.4 skill.
  • Gioele: Astrophysicist is now a Lv.2 skill.
  • Solid skill: Now permits carrying an additional item, up to 4.
    • This bonus is lost when carrying a Heavy item.
  • Determined skill: Redesigned.
    • Once a day: Guarantees that an action will succeed on the 3rd attempt.



More later, maybe.

On march 26, 2014
David

The Mush are in dire need of a solution to the epidemic of 'Humanity Tests' that have become the cornerstone of anti-Mush playing. These two skills ARE the solution.

Bacterophile (Re-named to Hypochondriac, because it's a better name): For one AP, you can give someone a random disease or mental condition, including other Mush, and even yourself! These illnesses become active between 1-3 cycles after being used, however it's instant if you use it on yourself. This action is covert.

For Mush, these illnesses would act as 'phantom diseases' that generate logs and can even be 'cured' as normal diseases can, but nothing actually happens to the Mush. Those gifted in luck and lying might even be able to create a false alibi as to why they were dirty two cycles ago! But, more importantly, no longer would randomly contracting a disease prove humanity.

Glutton (a new, preferably low-tiered skill): For one AP, you can force yourself to eat an article of food even though you're full, but still gain nothing from it. Forcing yourself to eat again generates the exact same log as regular eating when caught, but you get a special invisible (or should it be just private? I dunno) log detailing you choking down the food.

This would eliminate food tests being practical, and adds the ability to consume ALL THE RATIONS with some setup, allowing for a whole new avenue of Mush sabotage.

These two skills would add interesting new strategies to a gold player who wanted to go as deep under cover as possible. Combining these two skills, anonymush, and splashproof would make you, for all intents and purpose, invisible to the crew, and impossible to locate provided you don't fuck up. Sweet, right?
On march 26, 2014
Alfalfawar

Hardcore Mode.

[7950824]

I'd love to see two new drone upgrades:

Mobile Medbay which for twice the normal upgrade cost in materials and AP allows a drone to be modified so it contains all the same goodies as the medlab or a held medkit, allowing any room a drone was in to function identically to medbay (including surgery, assuming the room contains a place for the self-surgery person to lie down.... or not, if it's a medic doing the surgery to another [since medics can do standing surgery in medlab]).

Mobile Medic which for the normal upgrade cost in materials and AP, allows a drone which already has the Mobile Medbay upgrade to itself attempt healing actions upon injured crew in the same room.

On april 5, 2014
[8187798]

So I've gotten almost 5 games under my belt so far and the following are some general musings (suggestions) in relation to game mechanics. Please keep in mind, they're not entirely thought through and could possibly stand some refinement:

Manufacture of certain objects: I saw a post and shortly afterwards experienced the mush-Pasiphae-rush. In this variant, the offending mush ejected himself into space in off hours, causing the loss of the Pasiphae, apron, and soap. There may have been one other item, I'm not sure. Anyway, I got to thinking that the ability to manufacture certain items would be nice. It wouldn't actually break the game, considering the manufacturing requires time investment, though it can potentially repay those points:
‚Ä¢Soap: I was thinking that maybe soap can be researched in the lab with an alien steak, where the fat is rendered to make a new bar. It can then potentially be refined into the more advanced soap.
-I thought about possibilities for the apron but I admit I'm not entirely certain how to move forward with that. I did wonder about how the space suit might have been a potentially useful replacement though.
-As for the Pasaphae, maybe a way to rig (via blueprint) a patrol ship for recovery operations? Maybe it would take more AP to haul the bulk, so it won't be as good as having the Pasiphae.

AFK players: Well that's a problem and I think a lot of people experience it unless they exclusively do organized games. So these two thoughts aren't mutually excusive and can add a layer to the existing mechanics of the game (eg: reporting) :
‚Ä¢ Backfilling: If a player goes idle (ZZzz) for a predetermined amount of time in the first 3 Days (or other time frame,) they can be dropped and a new player selected to replace. The window would have to be within the first 3 Days in order to avoid major interruptions in the flow of gameplay.
Being dropped could flag the player's record for administrative reference. Naturally, getting a lot of flags could get a player in worse trouble. In addition, being dropped can also come with the penalty of no exp/glory.
‚Ä¢ Activity Rating: This could be a visible stat for all to see, and could be used in a future player seeding process that would improve gameplay as far as crew activity is concerned. The idea is basically a rating based on AP/MP expenditure over a certain amount of time. In this case, I would go with per Day, so: (AP/MP)/Day. This value will tell us how active the player is in contributing to the game. One might ask about mush play. Well the points average out over time and the more a player plays, the more the averages work itself out. It doesn't mean a player tagged as a mush is out of luck for their next game because even active mush players have to expend points somewhere, versus less active and idle players.
So what about low Activity Rating players? Well depending on averages, this might mark a player as a chronic idler and, I suppose, it would be up to the powers that be what happens to them. The seeding process would depend on how you plug the activity rating in, but offhand I picture it keeping a floating average (perhaps with exceptionally low ratings culled completely*) and then seeding players with the average as a target (give or take on accuracy, of course.)

Not perfect but they are just musings..

BadBlanket

This has probably already been suggested before but it would be awesome if NERON became a human-controlled character. You get 1 AP per cycle. You get free "movement" from room to room. You get the ability to do things from NERON updates/projects. Like one update may give you the ability to try to fix things at an AP cost. Maybe one will allow you to take a few shots with a turret. Cameras can work in that if only a camera catches the action, instead of displaying it in a public log, it is displayed in a log to NERON who can report the action.

That brings me to the next thing, MUSH-controlled NERON. That pretty button that turns NERON into a sour puss. If it's pushed it gives NERON the ability to do some pretty jerk things. Depending on the upgrades, it can enable a "flipped" NERON to do the opposite. If he can fix an object, he can have the chance to break an object. If he can fire on hunters then suddenly he can fire on an ally patrol ship. He can also obtain notifications like broken O2 tanks or hunter attacks and can report them himself or keep it quiet so it takes the crew a few to notice. This will give MUSH more use with the NERON-specific abilities that give them access to Bios. We all know a lot of us play Janice just to talk like a jerk at the crew.
On april 15, 2014
Kyubey

Ofc people suggested a lot of times before to make Schr√∂dinger a playable character. I just want to speak a little about an example how to make him. Don't take this very skills or numbers seriously, it's written mostly for fun and maybe to give some ideas for others.

Character: Schr√∂dinger
Max health: 6
No morale points. Schr√∂dinger never gives up!
Max action points: 12
Max movement points: 12

Trait: Cat
- Schr√∂dinger has no inventory, he cannot pick up any objects
- Schr√∂dinger can hear chat in his room. If there is any person in the same room with walkie/itracker/brainsyncs, Schr√∂dinger can hear general chat as well.
- Every word Schr√∂dinger says will be replaced with "meow", still he is allowed to use that kind of communication - for example one "meow" for yes, two "meow" for no. Schr√∂dinger will be heard only in the room he is located. Raluca see the original text, she understands her cat.
- Schr√∂dinger can lie down in every room, cat does not need a bed to sleep. But he cannot lie down on cycle he did any actions or moved (or it will be like infinite sleeping).
- Consume - free - Schr√∂dinger can eat rations, bananas, alien fruits, he can even drink coffee or eat pills, but only 1 thing a day.
- As human, Schr√∂dinger detects Secret actions now

Allowed actions
- Hide an object - 1ap - same as humans. Somebody can say "ok, cat can hide soap or something small, but how he can hide freezer!", but really, how can human hide a freezer in empty corridor?
- Search - 1ap - quite same as humans, but Schr√∂dinger will reveal the object to everyone once he find it, not just for himself
- Trust - 1ap (need to target a human) - after a human is selected, he will never take any damage if he pick up or hug the cat. Raluca is trusted from the beginning.
- Break free - 2ap (if he is picked up) - a person who is carring Schr√∂dinger take 2 damage and drop him.
- Attack 1ap - attack a human for 1-2 points of damage

Skills:
Level 1 - Nice cat
Schr√∂dinger give 1 morale to random person, who is lying down in same room with him. Caress gives +4 morale instead of +3.
Level 2 - Predator
Damage of cat's attack is increased to 1-3. Humans have -25% chance to hit him.
Level 3 - Support
Schr√∂dinger can reset lab, project, PILGRED repairing for 2ap, but he don't do any progress. For 2ap he can also give any human a second chance a day to fix the link.
Level 4 - On the hunt
For 1 ap Schr√∂dinger can hide in the room. Also logs "Schr√∂dinger entered the room" or "Human dropped Schr√∂dinger" will be deleted. He can hide with humans in the room, but not with camera.
Level 5 - Observant
Same as Eleesha's skill. Free searching and 25% to delect Covert actions.
On april 15, 2014
[7918569]

Pretty neat idea, actually!

His MP maximum should be heavily nerfed to make him more reliant on people holding him and carrying him around, and his AP maximum should be nerfed to make it less likely that a cat suddenly murders the shit out of somebody. The various supportive abilities you describe should also likely be limited to whoever's holding Schr√∂dinger, to add more incentive for that and to create a symbiotic gameplay relationship between Schr√∂dinger and other players (particularly Raluca). And while you're at it, you can think of ways for how he interacts with the Mush, for instance only requiring 2 Spores to be converted, etc.

I'd probably replace Predator with a skill that completely refills his AP and MP regardless of what kind of ration he eats, so that Schr√∂dinger can focus on gobbling pills and bananas rather than taking away from the ration stock.

It might also be fun to experiment with some sort of reward for hiding stuff, to turn him into a bit of a liability for the crew in return for personal benefits.

It might even make sense to entirely remove his MP gauge and add some sort of "Vent Explorer" skill that allows him to switch location by himself - either to an adjacent room once per cycle, or to a chosen/random room across the ship once per day. Cats can't open doors, after all, but they can probably find ways to sneak all over the vents.

That kind of non-standard gameplay would really add a lot to the game.

On may 1, 2014
[7971963]
Necrodem

Nidhoeggr MassMushification make all ship dirty. Well players can`t analize a planet, work with Comm. terminal, do research or project progress...

Well... no need to break.

I think about another mush skills.

1. Mushtate(based on mutate) give you +1 max every 8 cycles after taking this skill. Doesn`t safe after transfere, but safe if you become bercerx.

At first I was going to say Ew, no. Mush don't need any ways to rampage better, but then I realized that this would encourage rampaging Mush to wait a few days before doing it. Seems decent, but you should only get the HP bonus if you mutate.

Essentially reworking too: 1. Insidious Growth. Every 8 cycles after taking this skill it gains a charge. When you mutate, your HP and current HP are increased by the number of charges on this skill.

2. Bloodlust - every time when human in same room losing part of it mush will reganerate 1 (stackeble with multi-char damage).

Horrible idea, Mush do not need more incentive to do an early berserk-rush. This would be stupidly powerful with a Ian Mush with Hardboiled and the armor. Just sit in a dorm and let everyone around you die after you rampage. Yuk.

3. Dominance - Mush regenerate +1 AP and MP in each cycle in which at least half the crew are Mush.

This is a fringe benefit at best. You already kind of agin this once you have half the crew as mush due to the number of free beds. Don't see the point really.

4. Mycelium intelligent - your spore cannot be wasted. If player avaid/block contaminating spore safe and you can use it again(you need create it again).

If you spike Chun, you deserve to lose your spore. Frieda is a bit of an exception, but that's countered by Antique Perfume being totally a mostly-worthless skill. Likewise, Hygenic is already a double-edged sword for Derek (as it is harder for him to prove his humanity with illnesses.) I see no reason for this skill.

5. Evo-Mush - block one random research(work with all researching even if you don`t get it yet - you can still learn it but got no bonus even if player who take this skill die). Humans don`t get for it. If research should give you an item(Super soap, Natamy etc) - it will not but it will spent you base item(destroy soap, blaster etc).
Humans don`t know what research will it be but mush see it in they own chanel.

No. No. No. No. Mush already have counters for research, they don't need a free passive counter for the things explicitly meant to counter them.

If you want a skill to counter research-heavy ships, I suggest the following:

Setback - (Visibility - Special)Once a day you can set you can reduce the amount of progress into a project, research, or PILGRED for 2AP. This occurs between one and four cycles after you use setback. This appears in the logs like a normal participate, and appears as participate for Confident, Torturer, and Premonition.

Setback reduces research, project, and pilgred % by two times the maximum possible value of that particular research. (So using Setback on PILGRED would reduce it by 26-30%, as Physicist/Tech Raluca can get 13-15%)

If a research completes before setback triggers, the setback is wasted.

New skill: Quarantine Prevent target to any agressive actions for 8 cycles. Ones per game. Possible char Chun 6lv

New skill: Cat Lady Cat cuddle give maximum morale for you. Possible char Raluca 6lv

New skill: Annoying Reporter Lower target by 2 cost 6AP uncover as many actions as left(work only if lower by half). Possible char Eleesha 6lv.

[8206731]

Combine it with the ability to secretly pick up and drop items for 1ap while prowling and you have a awesome utility tool, as long as while prowling in a room with another person they add a "this person is sneaking around" in the room log. Also if the crew picks up a dead trail then they deserves to rat out the mush, as the mush should start their trail again in the room the started prowling in.

For example you can make the sofa with the tube and a plastic scrap instead. If this seems too powerful then maybe you can use two plastic scraps for one metal scrap for example.

Finally Annoying reporter sounds a little too pointless, half the time it wont work and just do moral damage and half the time it will work and not be much better than premonition (which should reviel two actions in my opinion). you should make it like torturer. Eg " For 3 ap, once per day target loses two moral and revieles their last X actions, X being their missing moral". It sounds stronger than torturer but you can't do damage to moral normally and 2 moral is not something you would want to use on your crew members constantly, especially if the crew is having moral issues. Also it should be lost as mush for obvious reasons, demoralize is bad enough. Also if you want to add even more to this skill, it could share a description as demoralize for the target, Just to keep the crew on their toes.

I wouldn't price the reporter skill at 0ap otherwise unwise players will feel obliged to use it every day and cause problems for their crew. Crew members usually don't run around the ship with full moral so having Eleesha do two moral damage is already going to get a good result.

Most people are not paying much attention to the minimap as its not updated in real time. I think you have to add more to this skill or else mushes are going to be running all over the ship and sporeing people without leaving any messages in the rooms.

Your right, not all skills are good, but they should be in a perfect game. Unlocking more skills should give you more variety, not more power. That skill would give 3ap a day which is ok for a skill but its dependent on reluca having Schrodinger which would more than likely take reluca some movement to get.

On may 2, 2014
SummerMcLovin

I do get some of what you're saying, Necro: Gioele's Caffeine Junkie is more reliable and easier to get, but a major benefit for Ian's Frugivore is that he can actually get it.

Along with his other gardening skills he can get a powerful garden that is pretty much his alone: same with Gioele's pre- and post-PILGRED Coffee Machine. They don't compete with each other, and its twice the benefit to the ship to have two super-AP monsters running around.

No-one's going to take it as a Bronze skill (I wouldn't fancy waiting at least 125 days to get the required experience!), but it's a good supplement especially if you are Gold: Firefighter and Mycologist are fairly low-priority to take.
On may 2, 2014
[8206731]

In accordance to the engineering skill sperbi, i already suggested the extra blueprint you should read what i had suggested on the last page. It has Reluca throwing cats at people . Anyway, Why not think about what the other skills do and how much AP each of them save/earn.

For example, Technician gives one Tech point a day which is worth 1ap, tech also saves about 1 ap per day on repairs for bonus % on repairs, tech also gets bonus % on pilgred and several projects witch save roughly 2 ap per day. In total Tech is worth 4ap per day.

Logistics expert is worth 8ap per day, but the disadvantage to this skill is that the ap is only available to other players, and only if you make sure you share a room with other people, it also has a random element and can be given to mush accidentally. So its twice as effective than technician but comes with some major disadvantages.

Caffine junkie is worth 2ap per day for two thirds of the game and then worth 16ap per day the last third. this means its worth 6 or 7 ap per day on average. However this skill is bugged as pilgred should only make 4 cups of coffee a day instead of 8. So the skill should be worth 8ap per day in the last third. This skill should be worth 4ap per day on average, but is currently bugged.

So i would suggest to look at your skills and try and make them add up to 4ap per day on average, or give a bonus comparable to two useful items such as green thumb or paranoid. Just my views of skills and how they are balanced, but i might be very very wrong.
On may 2, 2014
sperbi

Ah, yes, I have read it now, Rod_Roy ^^.

But I have to say something to Technician, since I like to be a Technician and I think it is the most important skill in the game. You can't say that Technician is worth 4 ap a day. Technician is in lots of situations useful and it is difficult to compare it with just a bonus of aps.
For example you always use the technician points to dismantle things at the beginning of the game. For each try you need normally 3 or 4 ap (3 ap: shower, 4 ap: microwave).
Also you have the huge bonus for some projects. people without Technician would need probably 2 participations to get the same progress like a Technician. So if you spend 6 ap they would have to use 12 ap...
Furthermore a Technician has more success repairing things. Even if you fail repairing an equipment at your first try you won't get an equal chance of sucess for your second try like the Technician already has with his first try.
But the biggest difference you can see with Pilgred where every participation needs 2 ap. An average progress of a Technician is 6% at Pilgred and 1% for a Non - Technician. So without considering of the boost of relaying a Technician would need 32 - 34 ap to finish pilgred and a Non- Technician would need 200 Ap to finish pilgred...
On may 2, 2014
sperbi

Oh I even forgot to mention the Plasma shield
Technician is so good *-*
On may 2, 2014
[8206731]

Technician is a bit of an hard one to work out but here is my justification about what i said. The average to repair something on the ship is ~22% which without technician will cost roughly 4-5 ap on average, and with technician it will cost ~2-3, however most of the easy to repair stuff is handled by the rest of the crew so what will usually saves the techs 2ap only saves 1 as the percentage goes down. usually having a bonus in a research or a project only saves you specifically from one participate so only 2 ap per project roughly and projects usually get pumped out one a day if three people are working on them (depends on the project and number of people though). Three people have to spend 8 ap each to get the average project up to 96% if they all relay the project once each update and all have no bonus from skills. Either each person without a bonus needs to relay 4 times and the person with the bonus 3 times and gets to save 2ap to complete a project or the person with the bonus gets to relay four times and the other two without the bonus gets to relay 3 and save 2 ap each. Try it yourself an average project will update 8% each relay and with the bonus the relay will be 13%. Again this is for a prefect relay which never happens so this will usually use more than 8ap each. Finally to do with dismantling, Tech is a compulsory skill for the crew so it has a mage book, dismantling is just a task that needs to be done by someone, doesn't matter who so just having the ability doesn't save ap.

If it sounds like i'm talking gibberish ignore me, i have done a lot of work on games and their mechanics and can get carried away sometimes.
On may 3, 2014
sperbi

if you only focus on projects (of course technician is useful in much more areas) than let me say that it not only gives you a bonus for your first participation, it is also possible for you to advance a project with at least the same or still higher amount of progress like a Nontechnician in your second advance in a row (I think even with your third advance in a row you have the same chances like a Nontechnician). That's useful if you can't wait for a reset

On may 3, 2014
[8206731]

True, but that still means that your using more ap in general because you are not working at pique efficiency. Also you said it yourself techs have other things to do too, so spending all of the days ap relaying is not going to happen most of the time. I'm just explaining why it saves 2ap on research per day. If a tech decided to only relay for a day, he might save more ap but he would not be able to go and fix things or deconstruct stuff, so they lose the ap saved from the repair bonus and if he doesn't spend his tech points then he will lose them too if he already had two. Tech is a balancing act between all your bonuses to get the most out of your ap. Also this doesn't factor in the fact that techs only get bonuses on half the neron projects, something else that a tech has to keep his eye on.

besided we are getting off topic, i was just making a suggestion about what kind of frame you can fit your created skill in, to see if its powerfull enough or not to match up. You dont have to if you dont want to.

Back to reluca and her cat

Sorveevur

I would like more skills that add useful items into the game.

Like an "Equipped Chef" skill for Stephen which adds a second apron and knife to the game. (Might be a bad example.)

Chao could get a skill which adds a special blaster, Chun or Finola could get a syringe for all kinds of uses (mush blood samples?) and Derek could get a worthless medal which gives him one morale every day as long as he is holding it.

These item skills could overwrite any bad, situational skills. (Opportunist and Intimidating spring to mind.) Or they could be added as new skills or as additional effects to already existing skills.

On may 3, 2014
Kyubey

Actually I'm bored by some things:
- to damage the ship hull you need to take off/land without proper skill, that really looks stupid
- pilot looks like a great skill for enemy agent, but mush get quite no need in it - only stealing apron
- hacking bios is useless most of the time, as well as NERON Access skill
- moving to kill a craft stealer is really strange thing, and is really annoying if he is your commander.

So my suggestion is to add a new settings in NERON bios - "Allow friendly fire". Options:
- Off (default, everything as we have now)
- On with announcements
- On without announcements

After switching to "On", everyone can do new things:

From turret:
- Attack any patrol ship/Pasiphae (1ap, % to hit and damage can be different for balance)

From patrol ship:
- Attack Daedalus (1ap, % to hit and damage can be different for balance)
- Attack any other patrol ship/Pasiphae (1ap, % to hit and damage can be different for balance)
- Make an ambush for Icarus (4ap, at least 4 charges - will attack Icarus when it returns from expo, doing X damage to everyone in landing party)

More space battles always make a game more epic!

[8206731]

I like the idea of more skills which provide items, like a skill for Ian or Stephen which provides some alien fruit seeds that take twice as long to grow than fruits, but once the plant has bore fruit then the fruits can be planted like normal. (would be good for Stephen instead of Ian as he is a cook that has been everywhere , and Ian already has a skill that provides items)

I also like the idea of friendly fire, as long as you can not only shoot people down in space, but also retrieve their items using the pasiphae. I also think that there should be a way of towing other ships once they are broken, so you can retrieve the pasiphae using a patrol ship and then repair it so you can go out and grab the stuff that the mush had stolen. This of course would take time to do, so its up to the crew to think about if this was worth it.

This would stop one way of griefing (sort of) and provide a response one of the lamest mush stratagies.

On may 6, 2014
[7971963]

Tier 1: Stephen, Gioele, Kuan Ti, Derek/Chao
All of these characters are disposable/replaceable, or can function perfectly well with just bronze. Losing any or all of them will not cripple a ship.

Tier 2: Hua, Ian, Frieda,Eleesha
Each of these people have an important role on the ship to fill, and losing them hurts the crew a fair bit. Most of them can function just fine with their first or second skills

Tier 3: Finola/Andie ,Terrence, Roland, Raluca
Each of these characters are extremely valuable and losing them or having them inactive harms a ship's chances greatly. Having these character's as a gold will greatly improve your survival chance, and all four of them can "carry" an inactive or two. Andie alone belongs in T2. He's only up here because Finola is that much better than him.

Tier 4: Jin Su, Janice, Paola , Chun
The ship title-holders and humanities last hope all have rather complex tasks that require a lot of investment. Having any of these four inactive is a massive blow to the ship, and will cost you a ton of AP in the long run.
On may 6, 2014
Kyubey

I don't like the idea of tiers really, as I think generalists are harder to play then specialists. But in same time - idle specialist is much worse for a team. So I prefer to divide people in "how many different things they will need to watch and how many different problems they will need to deal with". Ofc here I'm speaking about first 2-3 skills, not Gioele with astronavigator or Hua with tech - it's for much more experienced players.

1. Generalists
[ You don't have special skills for any constant job on the ship. You should always communicate with team - where you help will be most welcome in current situation. ]
- Derek
- Stephen
- Gioele

2. Specialists
[ Your skills or title gives you a special work on the ship. Most of the time you will be working in one room on one task. ]
- Finola - research - lab
- Ian - garden - lab
- Kuan Ti - projects - nexus
- Frieda - planet scans - bridge
- Paola - comm link - bridge
- Raluca - PILGRED - engine room

3. Emergency Team
[ You don't know when the ship will require your help. You should check the situation as much as you can, to provide your assistance exactly when needed. ]
- Terrence - repairs
- Janice - morale support
- Hua - piloting
- Roland - piloting

4. Special roles
[ You need to understand quite everything that is happening on the ship to play your role successful. ]
- Jin Su ( commander, needs to be ready to move the ship quite any time)
- Chao, Eleesha, Chun (mush hunters, need to know everything about human and mush behavior, move across the ship enough to discover any mush activity)
- Andie (can cover so many different jobs, needs to understand the situation on the ship very well to help were needed most)
On may 6, 2014
Kyubey

Tier 4: .... Paola....
The ship title-holders and humanities last hope all have rather complex tasks that require a lot of investment.
Paola - lie down on the bridge, click buttons on comm link for all your ap once a day, cry "link broken fix, fix, fix!". If she is dead/idle her title simply goes to Eleesha/Stephen/whatever and they do the same work. And you call her as difficult and important as commander or mush hunters? Same as Frieda in difficulty and much easier to cover her position.
On may 6, 2014
Necrodem

Ian can be easy killed by shooter.
On may 7, 2014
[7971963]
KyubeyPaola - lie down on the bridge, click buttons on comm link for all your ap once a day, cry "link broken fix, fix, fix!". If she is dead/idle her title simply goes to Eleesha/Stephen/whatever and they do the same work. And you call her as difficult and important as commander or mush hunters? Same as Frieda in difficulty and much easier to cover her position.

Knowing in what order to press those buttons, when (and how) to eat, and communicating with the crew is invaluable. A good comms officer is very, very helpful and can do the work of 3-4 people. A bad one will cost your ship irreplaceable benefits. Not to mention that they are the only people who can trade.
On may 7, 2014
[8206731]

I agree with Jamini on this, paola is by far one of the more complex characters, and playing her poorly can cost the ship a lot of valuable bonuses. Also the tier thing was just to stop inactives and griefers from ruining so many ships because they chose important characters. Inactives and griefers will get ether tier one or tier two characters, while someone who at least has played for a month on their account can get tier three and then tier four characters six weeks into their playtime. Its only meant as a small speed bump for active players and a huge one for griefers.
On may 7, 2014
Kyubey

I guess, I just played too much as Paola myself, and had no problem with idle Paola. When we had idle one - just another character got her title and worked. Even without work on link we were ok, when without pilots or planet scans we died on d4-d6. Also it was easier to learn order like - v2.0-v3.0-xeloph-day 3 base-xeloph-day 5 base-v4.0..... then what planets are worth visiting on scans, and what project should I start in nexus. But now, with trading, the role really is much more difficult and requires to be active more then once a day, on cycle when rebel base shows up.
On may 7, 2014
Sorveevur

How about an option to swap crew with the alien transporters?

Inactives could be sold away and swapped for alien characters. This would allow players to join mid-ship as an alien. If they aren't named characters, they could have a random skillset every time and maybe even be named by the player. Of course, players could just make an obscene name for the alien and muck it up, in which case, preset or randomly generated names may be wise.

Obviously there are balance issues, since the humans would basically gain reinforcements. Perhaps aliens could be like more complex drones. Players could order AI aliens with varying skills to help around the ship, doing research relays and helpful stuff.

Alternatively, you could just make ultra-complex drones which can be ordered around by players using a handy command list to do specific stuff around the ship, instead of just fixing crap.
On may 7, 2014
Barlakopofai
Surgeon of the Pillhead

The "Join Mid-Ship" option is a persistent no, it will never be in the game. Find a better way to make it work, it's a good idea
On may 7, 2014
Sorveevur

BarlakopofaiThe "Join Mid-Ship" option is a persistent no, it will never be in the game. Find a better way to make it work, it's a good idea

Alright. How about you can only trade for alien crew members before the mush selection? That way you could trade away inactives and gain a new, active crew member. In addition, it would be fair since it is all happening before teams are set and before everything is in gear. It may be a gamble as to whether the new alien crew member is actually active or not but you could always receive them alongside other items such as oxygen. Since a trader always appears at Day 1, I think it could be viable to offset inactives and early griefers. After mush are selected, you can't trade for alien crewmembers any more.

Maybe as the community grows and ships fill up quicker my idea won't be so viable any more but I'm just tossing it out there.

On may 7, 2014
Barlakopofai
Surgeon of the Pillhead

I had a better idea. The "Brain Control Chip". In exchange for an inactive for 4 cycle, the aliens install a remote-controlled brain chip on the inactive. Then, using the Remote, a person can connect to the inactive and control him as a normal person.

  • The inactive does not gain any AP from sleeping anymore and will move out of the room each cycle, spending no MP.
  • The inactive is dead and cannot come back, and receives the status "Braindead", to indicate it is not acting on its own. The remote must be dropped in order to stop using the inactive.
  • The inactive has 1 inventory slot filled by the Brain Chip Antenna and it will drop all objects in its inventory upon disconnection.
  • The inactive makes mumbling noise when someone walks into the room.
  • The logs on the inactive show do not show the room logs. They do however show which rooms the inactive passed through and who logged in on it
  • The Remote spawns on the bridge

Admit it, it's genius
On may 7, 2014
Sorveevur

BarlakopofaiI had a better idea. The "Brain Control Chip". In exchange for an inactive for 4 cycle, the aliens install a remote-controlled brain chip on the inactive. Then, using the Remote, a person can connect to the inactive and control him as a normal person.

The inactive does not gain any AP from sleeping anymore and will move out of the room each cycle, spending no MP.
The inactive is dead and cannot come back, and receives the status "Braindead", to indicate it is not acting on its own. The remote must be dropped in order to stop using the inactive.
The inactive has 1 inventory slot filled by the Brain Chip Antenna and it will drop all objects in its inventory upon disconnection.
The inactive makes mumbling noise when someone walks into the room.
The logs on the inactive show do not show the room logs. They do however show which rooms the inactive passed through and who logged in on it
Admit it, it's genius

Raluca: "Guys, this isn't funny! "

On may 7, 2014
Barlakopofai
Surgeon of the Pillhead

The inactive mush can be used by his partner, the actions for mush stuff doesn't appear otherwise.

  • The inactive mush receives the same skills as the first mush partner to connect, stacking together.
  • The inactive cannot carry more than one spore.
  • If the mush is dead, the inactive will not act in any mush fashion and therefore doesn't need to be killed, although it counts as a mush onboard for the end game
On may 8, 2014
[8206731]

or you could have it so if a inactive character is made braindead mush or not, the mush characters on board can spore the braindead. The spores can then be used to spike other characters like a normal mush by any mush character on board using the remote. Also any character that has the trapper skill can trap the breandead, and the next action the braindead does in a room traps that room (wasted if room is already trapped). Finally a new mush skill "Assume Control" cost 4, secret, Once per game a Mush takes full control of a braindead or grand inactive character on the ship, all actions cost 1ap more to do, lasts for four cycles.

[8206731]

I didn't say anything about a drone with extra abilitys I was meaning you had a control that could be used with the character like you originally suggested, just that a braindead character isn't mush after he is converted to a braindead. Instead the active mush still has to do some work that might get him caught instead of just controlling a pawn that has no relation to himself. Finally I added that because both human and crew can become braindead the mush if there is still two of them and they get their hands on the control can do the following series of events

Mush one plants a spore on a braindead
Mush one spikes the human
Mush two spikes the human
Mush two uses the control to spike the human and turn him mush

Its a double edged sword having a braindead on the crew, that can be effective for both sides on any ship.

Also i think there should be three controllers that get scattered around the ships storage rooms that can control any braindead, just so that the controller isn't held by one character (namely chun) the entire game.

On may 8, 2014
[8206731]

Ok I'm probably not going to convince you ether way but here is the reasoning behind a few of the ideas.

Shrodinger is more like my idea than yours as you have to give him a spore and then he might spore humans between 0-3 times. He dosen't generate spores and use them on whoever he is told to every day, he only hits maybe Finola/Andie or Ian once each per game if you are lucky.

Having the braindead mush spore people and then the crew works that out, that kills two mush not one, both you and the braindead character are both dead because you made a mistake. That makes the job of the crew easier not harder as the crew then know who the two mush were.

Having three controllers that get carried around adds more stratagy to this idea for both teams as the human team has to keep an eye on who has the controllers while the mush have to keep their involvement in the braindeads a secret. If the controllers stay on the bridge then only paola or frieda will use them.

What you are asking for is that:
A - Metagame would make it so Paola or Frieda will be selected to be the only one to use the controller and have to be mush to use the control and be able to control another mush.
B - The braindead would have to be a mush at the same time instead of one of the other three inactive players on the ship (as there is usually about four as far as i have seen).
Thats an astronomically low chance of this ever panning out that way, and dosen't help with the inactive mush in the slightest if one or both are not true.

In my example anyone can use the braindeads as the controllers can be carried around, and if there is a braindead on the crew then they are a constant threat as long as the mush live as they are and extra infection per day pretty much. Like I said, the crew has an extra member, but that extra member gives the mush an extra weapon.

Shrodinger is less like your idea because I'm saying that the Braindead was a mush off the bat. That's as if Schrondinger was a mush off the bat, it's not happening. Your idea only applies for sporing the Braindead.

On may 8, 2014
[8206731]

Shrodinger is a mush can when you spore him once and he sometimes scratches and infects people. I was saying that the braindead is never a mush and is just being used by the mush as a kind of transporter of spores, you have to keep giving spores to the braindead so he can keep using them on people. (basically your giving shrodinger a spore so he can spore someone else for you, but you don't have control over it and he only does it a few times max, so basically a spore for a chance at between 0-3 spores on different people). The reason i say its like mine is because its a spore for a spore, you spore the BD and they use it to spore someone and then you need to spore them again, but its more reliable than Schrodinger as you basically can target people with it. (I kinda realised this is a bit of a dumb argument, shrodinger is the last game mechanic we should be comparing this to as shrodinger is a luck based mechanic, compared to this obviously reliable based mechanic we are talking about)

If the crew decides to keep the braindead mush then all you have done by letting the crew know that the BD is mush, is help them out more as they effectively have 15 crewmembers now, and know who two of the mush are. Its like killing two mush as you no longer have to worry about them, still two for the price of one and you get to keep one like you have cured them.

Having the controllers spawn when the ship starts lets the controllers pass hands a few times before the braindeads come aboard. Besides the reason i said specifically three is because that means that the crew will fight over who gets to have them as most people will only be able to carry two plus their talkie, and chun can't hold five items to keep them all safe (armour, hackerkit, 3 controllers). Hiding items is not a very hard thing to sort out, if you need one of the controllers then just search rooms. Mush already do this with hiding fire extinguishers and pyromaniac. Not to mansion if the controllers go missing and the mush pick them up to go hide them they out themselves as picking up things is in room logs, or if they don't pick them up then they are obviously in the storage rooms where they spawn making hiding them a waste of time.

Also your right you shouldn't be able to control a BD character if someone else has control over them. Put a five min timer on actions so if someone does not do an action or movement with a controlled character they automatically disconnect.

I do see your point about spikeing the character to turn them mush after they are BD, but its still verry situational as one of those three characters mentioned have to be mush to even use this technieque in the first place. I just see it as being more fun if all the crew had access to this little game of chess with BD .

Also i already put the new mush skill up there specifically to screw with BDs (and Grand Inactives) which allows them to take controll of them once per game without a controller. check it out, if three people have controllers and the BD suddenly goes nuts then the people holding the controllers will be to blame right, but if that skill exists, then there is always an air of doubt, much like why slime trap was added.
Its better than saying that the mush just always have access because then people will know something is up when geoele takes control of the BD when only paola, jin su and frieda are allowed to touch the controls. And if it doesn't show who is controlling it when a mush takes control the we are back to the pawn without repercussions problem again. There must be some repercussion for action, some cost or problem or else its just OP. "Assume control" has a cost (4ap and its once per game) and a problem as you lose control of your own character for four cycles. I think it would have to be covert and not secret, or only make you lose control for two cycles(one cycle change) because four cycles in a random room is a little obvious.

If the crew decides to keep the braindead mush then all you have done by letting the crew know that the BD is mush, is help them out more as they effectively have 15 crewmembers now, and know who two of the mush are. Its like killing two mush as you no longer have to worry about them, still two for the price of one and you get to keep one like you have cured them. Yes, but you forget that the 1 mush was controlling 2 people and therefore, he counts as 2 mush

Having the controllers spawn when the ship starts lets the controllers pass hands a few times before the braindeads come aboard. Besides the reason i said specifically three is because that means that the crew will fight over who gets to have them as most people will only be able to carry two plus their talkie, and chun can't hold five items to keep them all safe (armour, hackerkit, 3 controllers). Hiding items is not a very hard thing to sort out, if you need one of the controllers then just search rooms. Mush already do this with hiding fire extinguishers and pyromaniac. Not to mansion if the controllers go missing and the mush pick them up to go hide them they out themselves as picking up things is in room logs, or if they don't pick them up then they are obviously in the storage rooms where they spawn making hiding them a waste of time.
