Also your right you shouldn't be able to control a BD character if someone else has control over them. Put a five min timer on actions so if someone does not do an action or movement with a controlled character they automatically disconnect.
And there goes a flat out no that does not even need to be explained

I do see your point about spikeing the character to turn them mush after they are BD, but its still verry situational as one of those three characters mentioned have to be mush to even use this technieque in the first place. I just see it as being more fun if all the crew had access to this little game of chess with BD . It's not situational at all. You just walk him somewhere and you spike him, easy peasy, even easier than spiking a normal person.

Also i already put the new mush skill up there specifically to screw with BDs (and Grand Inactives) which allows them to take controll of them once per game without a controller. check it out, if three people have controllers and the BD suddenly goes nuts then the people holding the controllers will be to blame right, but if that skill exists, then there is always an air of doubt, much like why slime trap was added.
Except it's a situtional skill that takes up one slot for a measley 12 extra AP at most. No one would take it because it's useless and you would be better off going on the bridge to take control and do your thing
Its better than saying that the mush just always have access because then people will know something is up when geoele takes control of the BD when only paola, jin su and frieda are allowed to touch the controls. And if it doesn't show who is controlling it when a mush takes control the weare back to the pawn without repercussions problem again.
Except the "Pawn with repercussions" is not a problem, because if you are a mush and your partner is Braindead, then you are controlling two mush and you have no interest in getting yourself killed.
There must be some repercussion for action, some cost or problem or else its just OP. "Assume control" has a cost (4ap and its once per game) and a problem as you lose control of your own character for four cycles. I think it would have to be covert and not secret, or only make you lose control for two cycles(one cycle change) because four cycles in a random room is a little obvious.
No AP cost, not once per game and you don't lose character control for four cycles. The action will be Secret and so finding the person is easy as you just need to look at who was alone for an extended period of time while the actions were taking place. Even that's more obvious and it's not debilitating to a point where the action is pointless.

On may 8, 2014
Barlakopofai
Surgeon of the Pillhead

A person who knows how game design works.

Remote Control

One immovable Remote
People are forced to share it since they can't carry it.
Can't hide it
Gonna end up only being used by people near it only

Three portable Controllers
Allows the remotes to be distributed across the ship.
Need to program a failsafe for more than one person using it at a time
People can hide it
One person will hog all the remotes
The Braindead won't have AP because of overusage

Mush and the Braindead

Mush takes control of his Braindead counterpart
Compensates the handicap of losing a player by giving access to 2 AP bars to the mush.
Harder to hide

Mush gets a skill to take temporary control of the Braindead and Grand Inactives
Undetectable
Every action costs 1 AP more
Grand inactives ignore the need for traders
It's impossible to know the AP before using the Single Use skill
Wastes a skill slot
Easy griefer behavior for the mush

Braindead can be converted and produce spores
The principles of Braindead: Physically able, mentally incapable

Braindead are never mush but carry spores
Quicker access to sporing for a mush
Cheaper version of Infector
On may 8, 2014
[1820301]
Barlakopofai

A person who knows how game design works.

Remote Control

One immovable Remote
People are forced to share it since they can't carry it.
Can't hide it
Gonna end up only being used by people near it only

Three portable Controllers
Allows the remotes to be distributed across the ship.
Need to program a failsafe for more than one person using it at a time same thing can happen if you have one immovable remote since you said you cant carry it anyways.. if two people accesses it at the same time what stops them from doing so?.. so for your idea you need a failsafe as well
People can hide it people can hide it which is good.. you have 3.. so why not?
One person will hog all the remotes which gives more flexibility.. same thing can happen to your idea.. one person can just use the terminal and use up all the BD AP/MP..
The Braindead won't have AP because of overusage and your idea prevents that?

BarlakopofaiMush and the Braindead

Mush takes control of his Braindead counterpart
Compensates the handicap of losing a player by giving access to 2 AP bars to the mush.
Harder to hidehow is it harder to hide?

Mush gets a skill to take temporary control of the Braindead and Grand Inactives
Undetectable
Every action costs 1 AP more
Grand inactives ignore the need for traders isnt this applicable to your idea as well? if your partner is a grand inactive they wont be immune to traders
It's impossible to know the AP before using the Single Use skill which makes this a lil bit less overpowered which is good IMO
Wastes a skill slotif you're using it to your advantage why not?
Easy griefer behavior for the mush eh? the mush's role is to grief? what are you trying to prevent?

Barlakopofai

Braindead can be converted and produce spores
The principles of Braindead: Physically able, mentally incapable I can agree with this idea.. gives more power to the mush in terms of staying hidden for a sol infect or eden infect but almost impossible to prevent unless all braindeads are tested

Braindead are never mush but carry spores
Quicker access to sporing for a mush
Cheaper version of Infector an idea less inclined for the mush but it still has it's uses but you cannot say it is just a cheaper version of infector since if you convert the braindead that acts as a cheaper version of infector as well and the difference is the mush has to spore the BD in order to get spores..

[8206731]

Guys please stop, I meant to spur discussion not cause an huge personal argument. Everything that is needed to be said has been said. Let's just move on to our next discussion.

How about this, new mush skill "Ghost" cost 2, invisible, Eating a corpse gives you the option to become the dead person temporarily in looks alone. You keep everything else that is related to your character (eg skills, ap/mp/health, ect) When you walk through a room, everyone in the room loses one moral (only works once per time this skill is used), You leave room logs as if you where that character. This skill can be used once per body consumed, and can be activated anytime after a body is consumed.

RolandOH GOD THERE IS A GHOST OF CHUN RUNNING ABOUT THE SHIP!

RelucaSHE HAS COME BACK TO GET REVENGE ON US ALL!

This has some interesting uses, like sabotaging things with another name. But it is very easy to detect as whoever is in the room where the ghost started is an instant suspect. More usefull when death messages are turned off as you could kill someone and then pretend to be them for a time to mess with the crew. A bit like transfer but way easyer to detect and can be used multiple times.

[8206731]

Sounds like a fun mush skill, but being both secret and randomly timed, wouldn't it be a little hard to land on someone? Also would it cost ap, as being able to spam the ability for free would cause problems me thinks, although...

Finola wanders out of a dorm, gets hit by a plate. Wanders into central corridor, gets hit by a plate. wanders into front corridor, gets hit by a plate. wanders into a lab, gets hit my a plate.

FinolaWHY IS THE FREAKING SKY FALLING ON MY HEAD

wanders into medlab, gets hit by a plate, dies.

Ok, back to the questions.
If the plate didn't hit anyone, would it just be wasted, or would it hang around until someone was in the room? If the plate fell in a room with multiple people would it target someone randomly or selectively? If the plate was loosened in a room with a already loose plate, would it replace that plate or would they both be active, and if they are both active and fall at the same time would they hit the same person, different people or select individually? Would destabilizing plates cause damage to the hull?

I apparently have a lot of questions , although if it was me i would make it like trapper and have a destabilized plate just hang around until someone spends a cycle change in there. Its secret and hard to avoid, but is hard to hit the same person with multiple times.

1. 25% to not be infected by a spore
(Despite you're best efforts, Gioele staring and avoiding of you prevents you from infecting him.)
2. 25% chance of detecting covert activity.
(It appears Gioele's suspicion of [character] was right!) The covert action will then appear in the logs.
3. Disorder Paranoia (-3 ) should be added permanently to Gioele as long as Paranoid is one of Gioele's active skill.
4. 15% chance of losing 1 AP and 1 MP.

On may 20, 2014
[8206731]

That's why i said i think that it shouldn't be secret, randoms fine if it does has some acceptable coincidence or effect. what you have to think about is where people stand during cycle change, and that is dorms, medlab, lab, bridge, and possibly the engine room or nexus for reluca. The issue i have currently is that you have to use the skill in the room while it is empty, then you have to be lucky enough that someone comes into the room and hangs about for the correct cycle change. That's a really hard thing to do just for 4-6 damage, trapper is not as hard and it spores someone.

Actually I am seeing this as an ideal skill to constantly using in the dorms as it forces crew members out of the dorms and the use of three beds. If done right then there will be three or four suspects on the list of people who could be doing it. Also if each plate only hits one person randomly in the room, the chance of actually killing someone with this is actually fairly low, as you need to hit a person three-four times with it before it will kill them. Even if your lucky enough that the all hit the same person and they all drop one cycle after you set the trap, that's still half a day for that crew member to realize and get out of that room.

I would see this more as a resource denial skill like green jelly (which denies the use of certain machines). It denies the use of beds and it also denies the use of ap which the crew have to spend on healing instead of actually doing useful things. Also it can be used to soften up crew mates for a mush rampage.

So a few suggestions, if you wish to keep it random that's fine, as long as you can give the user some sort of confirmed effect after the random period, like either a primed trap which falls on the next person that comes into the room (suggest that the cost is 2ap and is still a secret action) or a plate falling in a crowded room (1ap and is a private action). Or you can make it some sort of curse where you use it on a target and a plate hits them in a certain number of cycles where ever they are on the ship, and can only be used on each person once per day (suggest a cost of 2ap and is covert). But whatever you do, you need something to make the skill easier to land (or you could make it outright kill them because that would be an acceptable outcome if you land with the current odds of hitting someone ).

How about this for a skill?
Gassy Aura, Private, 3ap once per day, You fill the room with a odorless gas that corrodes the ships infrastructure as well as the crews minds. In a random amount of cycles (1-4) the message "something about this room doesn't feel right" will appear, the room will have negative random events every cycle for four cycles and the room has a highly increased chance of causing accidents or getting dirty.

The skill is pretty much like your skill, but you get a huge outcome from it. Firstly the skill is just as detectable as green jelly. Secondly, like i said above its mostly about trying to deny resources, for example if you use it in bravo dorm then you deny three beds for half a day, and using the shower can cause accidents because of people picking up and dropping the soap. Thirdly people may be forced into standing in rooms where there is no cameras, allowing you to spore them. Fourthly, you can use this to cause havoc on the ship if you use it in one dorm on cycle 8 and then the other dorm cycle 1, wonderful wonderful havoc. The downside is that its rarely going to kill anyone, but who cares, you just denied 12 ap at least from the crew if they get out of the dorm, and more if they tank the damage from the random events.

Sorry for the long post, this skill of yours gave me an influx of ideas. IT HAS INFINATE POSSIBILITYS, MWAHAHAHAHAAAAAAA.

[7971963]

I have a suggestion.

Fixing an O2 tank grants +1 - With diminishing returns after the first eight times you do it.
Putting out fires grants +1 - With diminishing returns after the first eight fires you have put out.
Expeditions to a planet you scanned grant +3 - You only gain this bonus if you do not attend.

-Let's give Tech's and generalists more sources! What's the harm in it? Why should pilots (and Janice) be the only people who get a shot at leaderboards? If I'm getting more than 10-20 from doing the above... I'm probably keeping half the ship together myself. Shouldn't people who play for the team get rewards?
On may 21, 2014
Necrodem

jamini no sence to fix totally useless. We need change all glory system...

Every good(for your team) action gives you personal glory bassed on AP cost and effect. If it failed it give over 40-50% of it.

or...

No personal glory at all. All glory work for all team of mush/humans.

This can work.

But there is some problems...

First way give more glory for gold and silver players(because they got better effectivity)... and can cause "book greeding".
Second mean then you can`t be good in sleepy/bronze/new-players ship.
On may 21, 2014
[7971963]

Hoooold on, let's actually look at individual glory before we call it useless.

Jin Su - Gains glory from moving the ship, and is a pilot. Has no issue gathering glory.

Chao - Gains glory from killing humans, in long ships tends to put out fires. Often an Expo member. This change would give him slightly better glory gain.

Gioele - Gains glory from mush deaths, in long ships he tends to put out LOTs of fires and fix thigns. This change would give him better glory gain.

Andie - Gains glory from trades (often 0). Is a pilot. Gaurenteed expo glory. This character needs no glory fixes.

Derek - Gains glory from having sex. Is set up as a primary firefighter. This change would grant him somewhat better glory gain.

Eleesha - Gains glory from contacting rebel bases. Is a tech. O2 tank change would grant her a more stable source of glory.

Finola - Gains significant glory from doing her job. This update would not change her, but she really doesn't need an update.

Frieda - Gains glory from scanning planets and arriving at planets. Is a pilot. This update would boost her glory slightly. (But everyone can scan for planets). May need to be adjusted down if this change gives her more glory.

Ian - Gains glory from planting alien fruits. Very likely to be on expeditions. Tends to be on healing/fire duty in late game. This update would boost his glory slightly.

Janice - Best glory-monger in the game. Janice needs no changes except a fix to her expo glory-gain.

Hua - Pilot. Already gains extra glory from expos. Hua needs no buffs.

Kuan Ti - Gains +2 Glory for each project. Often a tech or astro. This would boost his glory seeking ability notably. Potentially may give him too much, compared to others.

Paola - Only gains a non-unique +8 from xyloph. Does not put out fires. Probably would still need another source of glory.

Raluca - Only gains a total of +8 from PILGRED. This change would SIGNIFICANTLY boost her glory.
Stephan - Only gains glory from taking titles and going on expos that have fights. This change would significantly boost his glory.

Terrance - Pilot, glory gain from upgrading drones, tech. This update would have a variable change to his glory, but would not impact him much unles he was not a pilot.

Chun - Gains glory from surviving/completing research. In later days she might gain a small amount of glory from this change. Doesn't really need much of a glory boost.



---
ON a character-by-character basis, the characters that benefit the least from this change would be Pilots, Janice, and Paola. The characters that benefit the most are Techs, Stephan, and Gioele. The Research Team is not affected by this change significantly.

With the exception of Paola this would grants The lowest-scoring players on average a notable boost to glory while giving nothing to The characters that routinely top the scoreboards. How, precisely, would this do nothing?
On may 21, 2014
Vince

I think these are good ideas.

But the basic point is that a glory system which compares single crew members is flawed not only because it is imbalanced, but because it inherently makes people play for glory rather than for the ship/team.


To quote myself:

Actions which give one person Glory (e.g. solving the MAD Kube) are not always in the interest of the ship, and vice versa. So in its current state, the Glory score is more of a means of comparing people's success at fulfilling a given character's objectives rather than how vital they really were to the success of the mission.


What bugs me most about glory, except for the glaring imbalances, is that it makes people act in silly ways just for that.

In my current ship we have a Roland who seems to fly as soon as there are hunters, no matter his or other pilots' AP, while "missing" opportunities to collect scrap. A Terrence who aggressively promotes spending the scrap we get on any available drone upgrade, and a Frieda who just scanned 5 planets even though we already had a good one. And a Derek who says he was on 40 ships but solves the Kube because he "does not know what to spend his AP on". Just to name a few.

So basically, the highest places (inherent imbalances aside) award the people who were best at getting away with selfish glory whoring without getting killed for it.


Add to that a Jin Su who just moves rather than waiting for the right moment, a Stephen and Chao who kill slightly suspect people against better judgement because it furthers their goals, an Ian who wastes fruit to "accidentally" kill plants, or lets them die, so he can plant anew rather than graft, or even a Raluca who helps the Mush by finishing PILGRED too early. And have them all eat rations to do that better.

Then you will see why ships where everyone just wants an award don't work, and why awards are not a token of good play as they are made out to be.
On may 21, 2014
Secondary
JaminiDerek - Gains glory from having sex. Is set up as a primary firefighter. This change would grant him somewhat better glory gain.

Thats not true, its something else, like flirting both sides or him flirting
On may 21, 2014
1412

While we're discussing the glory system, I would like to bring up the fact that Mush have a screwed-up system too. The only way they can hope to compare to humans is if they either kill everyone immediately or do nothing except for Mushy actions, and that would be a terrible strategy. Any ideas for reworking it?
On may 21, 2014
Kyubey

My idea about glory is to divide the glory into two parts:
1) Ship glory
Quite every action, that is beneficial for the ship increase ship's glory. Getting to new planets, killing hunters, finishing researches, maybe finishing projects as well, getting loot from expeditions, maybe dealing with fires and repairs and so on.
2) Personal glory
Every human gets it like he does now, but only things he did himself + character objectives counts. Like: surviving a cycle, taking part in expo, killing hunters (yes, some actions give glory to both pools), solving the mad cube. Mushes get their mush glory as before, but they can give ship glory as well.

After the game is finished instead of bonuses like +20 rerturning to Sol, ship glory is divided across the players. If humans won - more glory go to humans, if mush won - to mushes. The better is victiry, more % get your side and less % - your enemies.
For example:
Eden+cure (clean) 100% humans 0% mushes
Sol no cure (clean) 60% humans 40% mushes
Ship destroyed (humans survived longer then mushes) 40% humans 60% mushes
Sol no cure (with mushes) 20% humans 80% mushes

So if mushes could survive and win the ship that got reached to many goals, they will be rewarded with a lot of glory that humans earned for them.
Keeping personal glory is important for characters backgrounds and to make them different.
On may 21, 2014
1412
Kyubey

My idea about glory is to divide the glory into two parts:
1) Ship glory
Quite every action, that is beneficial for the ship increase ship's glory. Getting to new planets, killing hunters, finishing researches, maybe finishing projects as well, getting loot from expeditions, maybe dealing with fires and repairs and so on.
2) Personal glory

On may 22, 2014
[8206731]

I posted this in another thread about glory (and my god there is so many by now) but when talking about team glory i mentioned an idea where there is two team scores. One for the humans and one for the mushes. The idea was that all humans contribute to a human pool and all mushes contribute to a mush pool when they die or the game ends, and when the ship ends the pools are relieved to show the scores of both teams. Here is the kicker though, when a crew member dies, their glory is halved before being added to the pool, this works for mush too and the mush don't lose more gory after death. The reason for the mush not losing more glory after death is for rampages to still be a viable strategy, a successful day two rampage usually doesn't end the ship until day four or so and by that point there has been a bunch of glory been earned for the crew. Also When a crew member is turned then the glory they have is basically stolen (even though the glory doesn't get added to ether pool till after the character is done with) from the human pool and added to the mush pool, giving another reason to try and convert crew.

Basically makes the game a tug of war between the two sides, humans trying to keep the ship alive so they can get as much glory as possible meanwhile mush trying to end the ship quickly or convert people to steal as much glory as possible. Basically the strategies on board wouldn't change, just that there is a bigger emphasis on team play. Also i think the like system should act as the scoreboard, with whoever gets the most likes being at the top. (because i would always be 1st or 2nd then )
On may 22, 2014
Vince

An easy quick fix would be just to lose the Supernove awards. Then everyone would be interested in the ship going far (highest total score) rather than just being higher than the others (highest relative score).

As it stands, if people want novas, it is actually better for them to have ships fail quickly, because then you get more of them.
So the ideal strategy would be to get a quick boost, see that you score highest just above the Mush, then let the ship blow up.
Congrats, one more step towards being the "best player".

[8281354]

Suggestion - Is there a way to put some sort of tag on spacesuits to make them not a valid choice for item loss? Because really, how does strong wind blow off your sealed and pressurized suit? Or an alien snatch it without damaging you in the process?

Alternatively you could add an extra inventory slot for "equipped" items, but it's nice to have to balance the bonus from armor with the lost of available space, or having to choose between essential items for your expedition. It'd be kind of dumb with only two things to go in it, but that allows room for invention...

Action - Pick Pocket
2 AP (Not Aggressive)
Interaction: On Character
Stealth level: Secret (Reveled by Cameras)
Granted by: Sneak Skill, Nimble Fingers Skill
Effect: Using Pick Pocket steals a random item from the target. Items stolen go to the user's inventory. A stolen Walkie, Tracker, or Itrackie drops to the room shelf. If the user of the skill has too many items, the item is knocked over in the logs.

On june 10, 2014
wydamn

It would be cool if the communications officer had the option to initiate a vote to revoke a title from a character for the next 8 cycles. This would be extremely useful for when the commander or NERON Admin or even the Comms Officer themselves knew that they might not be available and needed someone to pass their title to the next person in line. This would also be a good way to deal with dangerous or incompetent NERON Admins and Commanders; for example a Jin Su who took the hacker kit and sat in a patroller to watch the Daedalus sit there and die.

The vote would need to be initiated by the Comms Officer, who could only hold one vote per day. If a 51% majority was reached, then the current holder of the title in question would become ineligible for that particular title for the next 8 cycles, starting at the next cycle change, and the title would pass to the next person in line for it.

This could be a game changer, but I think it could be a balanced way to deal with griefers/mush/inactives, and could also be an effective tool for the mush to use if they could convince the crew that a current title holder is dangerous/incompetent. More than anything, it's a social tool that could have some interesting results. And the 8 cycle expiration would discourage people from using it for frivolous reasons.

Any thoughts?

On july 17, 2014
[1820396]

NecrodemAnd track movement is quet useless with ACTOPII.ACTOPII is by no means standard on your regular ship. In fact, I didn't see it on any of 25 ships I was on. People don't tend to spend their money on golden projects unless a) it's MMM ship, b) they think the ship could achieve someting great with them (not probable for ACTOPII as it's only useful during the mush-hunt and you can't be sure the ship will get anywhere before it's done) or c) they are really good ones like Targeting Assist or Scrap Heap.

Also, ACTOPII only gives you informations about present situation. When you get back to MUSH after two or three cycles of sleep/school/work, it's nice to know where is who, but as mush hunter you also need to know where these people were BEFORE. Tracker makes this much easier. IT Expert or Technician are both nice skills but don't help Eleesha with her primary role as mush hunter at all and can be used by other characters.

And same for you argumentation for Frieda's pilot, or Paola's biologist, respectivelly. Both are skills useful for silver or gold players but don't have any effect on primary roles of the characters.

"Main role or job" is not the thing you must do on any ship, without speaking with your team. But the thing you should be ready for, and what you will get in most games.

On july 17, 2014
Misterme7

Just because Shrink is good, doesn't mean it should be rare. Without it, ships die. If both Jin Su's leader and Janice's Shrink were level 4 skills, ships would die. The mush would just have to take demoralize and enjoy a laughably easy time. All these are situational. However, Janice's shrink is not situational. Jin Su with leader can't replace that free 3 morale gain per cycle. And with your plan, Jin Su probably wouldn't have it. Yes, sometimes it's better to choose pilot as Frieda. It is never a good choice to not choose shrink as Janice. She's also the only way you can guarantee that you can cure psychological illnesses, as others rely on getting lucky with pills, fruit, or a shrink magebook. And if we're going by glory, Stephen should have shooter for his glory goal.

Necrodem

Misterme7
There are many ways to upped morale. Do things, bananas, Shodinger, Music-box, Arcade... Also improve cost of morale skills make Optimist and Detached better. Yes, this ways can make you infected... but it make game harder and more fun.

And I still think then Chun`s HLH should stay 1-st lv.

And I do not say then this should be now. But when MT want Finola to return it whould be a nice time to rework some skills/skill trees.

DTT is a once a day thing, and only offsets morale by 1. In the early days all the bananas should go to planting, otherwise you'll face O2 and fruit shortages. Schrodinger is a once a ship thing. Music Box and Arcade cost real-world money, and I have yet to see either one. If Shrink was beyond level 1, then ships would die. Let's take a scenario:

Janice doesn't have shrink, and the only morale options are speeches from Jin, Bananas, Shcrodinger, and DTT. Uh oh, Jin is mush! Now he and his partner can take demoralize, kill Chun, shoot the cat, destroy the plants, and game over for humans. Humans would only be able to gain 2 morale a day until day 5 rebel base from dtt, and that only offsets the loss from Chun. Raising Shrink would cripple ships, not make them more interesting.

On july 17, 2014
Kyubey

And ofc you don't need to target everyone. Just teches and morale support will be more then enough.

On july 18, 2014
Sagittaeri
Necrodem

Kyubey Then Janice should get Diplomat first Because her bonus.

Tracker best for Eleesha? Only one usage for it is check then ship are clean from mushes. Because list include only Alpha-mush names and if mush swaped with idler then it just useless at all. And track movement is quet useless with ACTOPII.

Observant look better, Teches look better, IT look better.
...

Anyone who's serious about playing as Eleesha will tell you that Tracker is infinitely more valuable than Observant. I would even go as far as say that Observant is only good for the "free searching" ability, which is very situational since most mush don't actually hide things, considering the risks. Its camera-like functions are not as useful as one might think, too.

On the other hand, Tracker is the single most important investigative mush hunting skill because of its ability to see 16 cycles of logs and the direction of people movements (now even more so with Defacer).

Sure, Tracker becomes useless after mush are dead. However, an effective mush hunt which results in the highest number of living humans is absolutely vital for any long term ship. Not to mention its hidden ability to check for Anonymushed mush via the 'print the list' function! So, in that sense, Tracker, when used correctly, is easily one of the most powerful skills for the human team.

As much as I love IT Expert + Technician combo (and I do love it very much), the ability to do effective mush hunting takes priority. The more people you save from the mush, the better chances your ship has of going to Eden.

On july 19, 2014
crawlkill

As a gold player who's basically useless in mush detection, I don't think it's meaningful to rank mush difficulty in terms of the number of gold players. I've seen bronzes who were invaluable in sussing out the mush, and I've seenand beena high-activity high-coordination gold who was clueless.

I'm pretty sure mush are supposed to have a hard time of it, which is partly counterbalanced by how many ships are loaded down with awfuls and inactives and fail on their own inertia, just helped along by the mush. With a fully-active fully-competent crew, I would expect the mush to have to be incredibly devious and lay as low as possible. I think that's fine. They're not "supposed" to win; they do, however, "get" to win. Mush not having much of a chance is what makes winning as mush such a thrill, even when you were really only riding the wave of a bad crew.

I don't think mush need buffs. But maybe some anti-mush tools need nerfs (I'm looking at you, Torture...).
On july 19, 2014
Kyubey

There are better projects, there are worse projects. Some of projects are very situational and I'm totally ok with it - anyway they cost different number of AP to finish, but I thinks it's not right, that there are projects, that nobody ever wants to see on the ship (except mushes ofc). There are some suggestions about thier possiable buffs (if projects is very easy to finish and it's totally useless now, I guess it's cost should also be bigger, if it's buffed).

Anomaly Detector
- Also shows cat and drones on the tracker
Anti-gravity Thrusters
- Chance of successful landing is 100% for non-pilots
- Taking off in Icarus cost 2 less ap
Auxiliary Terminal
- Auxiliary Terminals are also added to both dorms
Bay Door XXL
- Chance of successful landing/take off with patrol ships/Pasiphae is 100%
- Landing with Pasiphae cost 1 ap less
Convenient Sink
- Spending 3 cycles in AD or BD without leaving makes you clean, mushes take damage from that as if they took shower
Defective Piston Sensors
- Doors have 50% chance not to be break when such event was going to happen
Fission Coffee Roaster
- If PILGRED is online, you can take 2 cups of coffe on C4
Large Bay Upgrade
- Increases chance of successful O2 pumping
Magnetic Return
- Taking off in Icarus cost 2 less ap (stack with Anti-gravity Thrusters)
Pneumatic Distributor
- Instead of just moving food from garden to refectory add a new setting in NERON bios, which will allow NERON admin select a room, where food should be delivered
Rerouted Charges
- Allows patrol ships to recharge while flying at normal rate
Spatial Wave Radar
- Also doubles the chance to detect and meet traders

MinerX

Make a mush skill that puts a spore on someone even with camera in room, a skill that increases the # of people on the list by 1, a skill that puts a random injury on someone (only able to do while berserker), a skill that makes the deadaluss fall apart thing (metal plates, electric spikes etc) happen in 4 cycles (like green jelly and slime trap) etc... i think mush need to be more user friendl in early levels and especially to be bronze friendly
